story:
Why do this ?

As a Jamaican, It seems like whenever we travel and speak to someone they are fascinated by our accent and try every which way to get me to say something else. I used to say to myself WHY don’t they learn to say it themselves and stop harassing me ? LOL. Well sadly, there is nothing for them to learn from, outside of listening to countless hours of Reggae music. SO we decided to do something about it.  

WE WANT TO MAKE EVERYONE A JAMAICAN !!!!

 

What is the Rastamar-i app?

It's  a Jamaican Language (Patois) learning app with a superbly unique spin on language learning altogether. 

1. First go to "High"School and learn key words that will no doubt be an assest later.

2. After completing "High" School, take Rastamar-i through one of his many story board style episodes while he interacts with memorable and funny characters using the words you learnt in "High" School.

With over 10 story board style episodes, learning Jamaican (Patois) will be a blast !!!!! Characters are memorable and the situations are Hilarious 

Example of some Episodes:  Rastamari Goes to the Bank, Rastamar-i Party Time, Rastamar-i ITAL Cooking, Rastamar-i looking for HERB. Just a few of the many episodes we want to create !!!!

Who is Rastamar-i made for?

Anyone who wants to learn the coolest language on Earth, or Even for those who know it already but just want to test their knowledge and have some fun with a memorable and unique GAME. 

So, what's the plan?

  1. Reach fundraising goal! Without this, nothing goes forward.
  2. Finalize plans with Script Writer and Story Board Illustrator by July 2013.
  3. Developers create the app in August 2013.
  4. Beta-Testing August 2013.
  5. Launch the app by September 2013. 

 

Yow Mon ! Where will the funds go?

  1. 31% goes to App Development.
  2. 30% goes into script writing and story board development.
  3. 11% Website and Hosting.
  4. 8% Research and Licensing Costs.
  5. 7% Indiegogo and Credit Card Fees :( 
  6. 2% Server to Host App.
  7. 11% Advertising and Marketing

Who are we ?

We founders are all JAMAICAN "20 somethings" with backgrounds varying from Enterprise and Mobile App Development,(Black Russian and Mario) Web Development (Shadow) and Database Engineering (Ram Goat), Marketing, Project Management and Innovation Management (Daco). Therefore, we have the perfect mix of Nerds and Flashy personalities to make Rastamar-i a reality. 

We have been fortunate enough to have travelled the Globe and have seen what the world has to offer. We now think its time we offer something back, outside of our GREAT MUSIC AND CULTURE.  

Can I get it on my phone?

It will be available on iPhone and Android first, and hopefully more platforms after. 

 

Sceptical ?  

See another popular app we have built before: 

http://appworld.blackberry.com/webstore/content/52447/?countrycode=JM

 

Not ready to contribute yet? 

Share the campaign link with your friends, your family and your colleagues and you will already give us a tremendous tap on the shoulder!

Thanks so much for your support!

story:
You always wanted to be a part of a Space Program, right? Now, the good news is – you don’t need to spend 12 years of heavy training to become part of this real Space Mission! How come?

Because – right now - you are about to start your own personal Space Program. Beside receiving some cool Perks for your contribution, you'll get various levels of authorization to become part of our international Remote Controlled Spacecraft Mission Control Team.

Come and join us!

 

We’re determined - and on track - to create a privately funded, insanely efficient space program. In this first phase we are designing a nano-sat - a small satellite - that will carry a Space Telescope into Earth orbit. And... we need you to help us build our team, and... to become it's member!

 

You will join a team of real Space-Tech and Media experts. We will involve you in our actions, and provide you with the excitement of participating in a real Space Exploration Mission. You’ll be a part of this  space mission right from your chair. All you have to have is a computer.

 

You will be joining an amazing synergy of expertise from all across our planet. All you have to do is be smart (by arriving at this web-page you proved that already : ), have a PC, and know some stuff about space. And we’ll show you the rest.

Become a member of our international team, and help us show the world what amazing things mankind can do when acting together with the same goals!

 

Some unique presents are waiting for you. For example: Mind-blowing psychedelic real-time space art (for your eyes only), cool metallic membership cards with your name and your mission title, some stylish T-shirts, 3-D lenticular prints with amazing space images and your name on it, and... well.. read more about our Perks at the bottom of this page, and watch-out for updates about what those Perks will look like...

 

Upon reception of ultra-cool authorizations - you'll be able to do the following:

  • Monitor our spacecraft in flight
  • Talk/Chat with or join our Mission Control Crew
  • Communicate and report strange sightings
  • Control The Space Telescope's Camera
  • Take your first space photos
  • Analyze telemetry and sensor data
  • Search for near-earth objects/asteroids

You will gain exclusive rights to send your text messages via our Orbiting Spacecraft. Imagine - you'll be able to send mission-certified messages from space to your Mom, Dad, Friends, and... well... Lovers ;-). Your messages will have exclusive Synergy Moon Orbital Spacecraft logo. Perhaps you would like to send special video message to the World?

 

All in all - you can end up saving the earth from an asteroid, or be the first to notice extraterrestrials and perhaps communicate with them! In the worst-case scenario - you'll be able to watch LIVE images and videos from Space, and send exclusive Mission-certified messages - from Space - to your loved ones.

 

NanoSats are like the killer apps of space exploration – miniature and affordable satellites that can be designed, built, launched, and operated by a small group of experts. Our first NanoSat is a miniature Space Telescope which we will "park" in Low Earth Orbit. This Space Telescope Nanosat will then fly around the Earth providing a wide variety of scientific and edutainment applications.

 

We will design, construct, launch, and operate a NanoSat Spacecraft that will carry miniature Telescope into Earth orbit. The most crucial element of this spacecraft will be the Attitude Determination and Control System, which will allow us to aim the telescope at the desired targets and keep them in focus. 

 

We will use the funds raised here to acquire this space-qualified Attitude Determination and Control System for the Space Telescope, for NanoSat construction and launch, as well as for organizational development that will help us create the information technology infrastructure for this mission.

We’re Team Synergy Moon, an international group of techies, scientists, artist, adventurers and space-enthusiasts from all over the world.

Our team is proud to be participating in the Google Lunar X PRIZE, competing to be the first private team to put a robotic rover equipped with HD cameras on the Moon in 2015!

The primary consulting experts for this project are Gerard Auvray and Kevin Myrick – both members of Team Synergy Moon.

Gerard Auvray is a French electronics engineer who designs and builds amateur satellites.  Gererd was President of AMSAT-F for two years.  In 1993 he was responsible for the satellite ARSENE launched by Ariane.  In 1997, 1998 and 1999 he built the 3 small replicas of Sputnik launched by a Cosmonaut during his Extra Vehicular Activity from the Russian Space Station MIR. 

In 2002 , he launched 2 payloads from the third stage of an Ariane Rocket.  Today, he is building a solar sail named Libellule (Dragonfly).  Gerard also supports 2 french student picosatellite projects, is a communications consultant for two Google Lunar X PRIZE teams and is co-designer of Interorbital Systems TubeSat. 

Kevin Myrick - I am the founder and CEO of InterPlanetary Ventures, and co-founder of Team Synergy Moon, co-founded by another member of our crew -Nebojsa Stanojevic. Our Mission and Motto is Getting People Into Space!  I am a Technologist with degrees in Computer Science and Information Technology with over 25 years of experience in software development for online applications and data center management. 

Astronomical Society of Vidulini, Croatia - will be responsible for the construction of the NanoSat Space Telescope.  AUV (Astronomska Udruga Vidulini) is the space exploration technologies development group of Team Synergy Moon. AUV has created a series of networked telescopes and sent various scientific instruments to stratospheric altitudes.  Recently - as part of the Google Lunar X PRIZE Team Synergy Moon - they built a working prototype of the robotic lunar rover.

Pleiades Astronomical Society (PAS) of Tuzla, Bosnia & Herzegovina will manage Space Telescope’s Mission.  With over 150 space enthusiasts supervised by leading engineers and scientist - PAS will take care of satellite’s remote control, as well as reception, processing and distribution of scientific data.

 

 

 

Our remote-controlled spacecraft - NanoSat Space Telescope - will have following elements and functions:

  • Telescope - to view/image the Earth, the Moon, Planets and Stars
  • Imaging chips - to record video or still images from the telescope
  • Radio receiver and transmitter - to receive command and control signals and to send data and messages to earth or into the space
  • Active attitude control system - to navigate and aim the telescope

For the flight control and some other key operations of our NanoSat Space Telescope project - we ordered the Arduino-based Firefly Board - developed by Kentucky Space.

For custom applications and experiments involving the telescope and other sensors we will use the S series Gravity Development Board (GDB) from Solar System Express. 

Spacecraft's on-board electronics will send telemetry and image data which will be further processed using earth based E series GDB by our Mission Control Team, and perhaps - you -as our team's proud member : )

 

 

Our Education and Outreach partners around the world will facilitate workshops for interested teachers and student using the Synergy Space website, developed as part of this initial project.  The websites and apps will make this telescope available to anyone who wants to be a part of Space 2.0 - Space for Everyone!

 

 

All membership cards and certificates will be processed and shipped as soon as this campaign is completed, and you are going to love these items!  We're making them very special to show our appreciation for all of you, our supporters and now our partners in the Synergy Space Program!

Access codes and access to the Synergy Space and our Orbital Spacecraft Mission website will be sent in April, 2013!  This spring we will be doing testing of the spacecraft with high altitude near space platforms, and you will have access to those missions parallel with your authorizations for the final space mission!

Check out some additional Bonus-extra Team Synergy Moon Memberships included in some of the Perks you will be receiveing here on IndieGoGo.

 

 

Launch of the Synergy Moon NanoSatellite will be in the summer of 2013, currently scheduled aboard an Interorbital Systems' Neptune microsatellite launch vehicle.  You can read about Interorbital Systems' SmallSat Launch Program to learn more.

By participating in this Spacecraft Mission project as part of Team Synergy Moon - you will additionally help create our mission control, and build the participatory exploration infrastructure for our Team Synergy Moon Google Lunar X PRIZE mission, and test some of the communications hardware and procedures. 

Contribute what you can and join Synergy Moon Remote Controlled Spacecraft Team! Get into your first Real Space Mission!

campaign_city: Mojave, Paris, Vidulini, Tuzla, United States

story:
Who we are

We are Fabrizio Bianchini, an artist with an international background (www.jupiterfab.com) and Simon Coleman, an anthropologist who has worked in the dissemination of ethnographic techniques to schools in England and in collaboration with Brighton Museum, UK.

We work in different disciplines but have discovered that our work has an amazing amount in common. In 2011 we collaborated on a study of immigrant communities in the GTA, (one of the most multiethnic areas in the entire world)  looking at the way they relate with urban space and religion, creating a unique installation of sound and paintings in the Manifesto Community Project  (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sjIADUJeanA).

The project

Starting from our previous collaboration and teaching how to use both art and ethnographic tools, we want to help kids and their families to discover for themselves a better knowledge of who they are, where they have come from and where they live.

The core of the project is a workshop with children from 10 to 15 years old that we are running in different locations within the GTA, in collaboration with several social organizations (for instance ArtHeart in Regent Park area or Toronto City Mission in Scarlbourough) that work with children and young adults.

During the workshop, we introduce some simple tools of our respetive fields, such as the making of portraits, carrying out interviews, and tracing family histories across time and space. Using sound recorders, after learning how to do an interview, kids go back home and interview relatives about their experiences in the GTA when they first moved to Canada and/or when they were kids. Moreover, we ask every family to lend us both an old and a new picture of the family. With all this material we work and discuss in class with the kids and we help them to express what they understood and to translate it in any form of art (a song, poem, painting...) that we will use to create a traveling art exhibition in Toronto as well as outside this area to sensibilize families and institutions about how the sense of awareness of who we are, where we live and we come from can help to become a better person and a better citizen.

In the attempt to create something more interactive, more visible and involving more communities and institutions, we are trying to create a sound documentary of the entire experience using the interviews to relatives and interviews to kids too; an interactive digital record on the web where we can host all the images and interviews of the project, working on this aspect with colleagues at the Department of Anthropology at Toronto (Professor Frances Garrett and PhD candidate Matt Price) who have a wide experience in this kind of works; one or more murals using images of the pictures lent to us by families.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to complete the project in all its aspects, we would need a higher amount of money but we would be happy to receive at least something to make it happen.

In the last months, we received $ 5,000 by the ‘Religion in the Public Sphere’ Program of University of Toronto and the Centre for Community Partnerships, that allowed us to cover part of the starting costs. We also invested a lot of our spare time, as we genuinely think that it will help a lot of kids and families who live in difficult environments and difficult situations  but we do not have the presumption to be able to do everything by ourselves, and for this reason we decided to launch this campaign.

We ask for a small donation, a small sacrifice to help a lot of misfit kids and families to improve their situation, but also other ways to support us will be appreciate. We would be happy if anybody would like to offer some of his/her time and experience volunteering or advertise the project on the web or on any media...

If you want to receive more information do not doubt in reaching us:
FAbrizio jupiterfab@gmail.com
Simon
Thank you in advance, Merry Christmas and happy new Year everybody
 
Fabrizio and Simon

Volunteers, Supporters and Institutions involved in the project:
Soula Christin Gountouvas,  student York University
Centre for Community Partnerships and the Multi-Faith Centre, Toronto
Regent Park Art and Culture Center, Daniel Spectrum Building, Toronto
ArtHeart, Community Art Center, Toronto
Presbyterian church in Lawrence East area, father Alexander Wilson, Toronto 
Special thanks to Dexter Ico, who helped us recording and editing the video!!

story:
"A child miseducated is a child lost."



4 Students


We are 4 students, and studying information technology. We come from different countries.(Austria,Nepal,Southkorea, Italy) 
We had enough problems during our school life because sometimes is difficult to follow the teachers/lectors or subjects are to difficult.
The teachers  teach fast or the informations they give are complex...
The most of students should know this situations.


Study4you - Connecting students
 

Our aim is to build a E-Learning platform and this should be useful for students around the world. Study4you will be a non-profit platform because we think, informations and services for students must be free of charge.
Students will get informations from there and they can contact another students for help.

The most important thing is, motivating students to learn with various funny study contents. The most of students today are motiveless. They need fun while learning.

Some professors in our university will help us during the construction and the professors recommended us indiegogo.com for the financial sources.
We are planing this project for about 1 year. And now we found indiegogo.com, a chance to realize our project, for the first fime.
We hope and believe strongly, that we achieve our goal.

We need money to realize our project:

    • Domain&Hosting ( about 100 $ per year)
    • Design&Graphic (500$)
    • Seo(Search Machine optimization) ( 900 $) 
    • ChatServer, Webcam-Learn groups ( once 470$ after that 30$ monthly)
    • WebSite Security(SSL) ( 70$)
    • Webscripts, Advertising in different countries, (about 10.000$)
    • Translates( about 5000$)
    We can start with 1000$  to build the website.

    If we don't become at least 1000$ for the project, we will pay collected money, to any project, which could be useful for the students.


    When we achieve our aim, our last request from you is, to talk about this project, with your friends, neighbours etc. and it will be famous

    If you help, this could be best known and most helpful learning platform for students.

    That must not be financial help, you can also help with your ideas.  If you know better solutions for this project, please share this with us.


    Thank you very much.
story_txt:
"A child miseducated is a child lost."

4 Students
We are 4 students, and studying information technology. We come from different countries.(Austria,Nepal,Southkorea, Italy) We had enough problems during our school life because sometimes is difficult to follow the teachers/lectors or subjects are to difficult.The teachers  teach fast or the informations they give are complex...The most of students should know this situations.




Study4you - Connecting students 

Our aim is to build a E-Learning platform and this should be useful for students around the world. Study4you will be a non-profit platform because we think, informations and services for students must be free of charge.
Students will get informations from there and they can contact another students for help.
The most important thing is, motivating students to learn with various funny study contents. The most of students today are motiveless. They need fun while learning.

Some professors in our university will help us during the construction and the professors recommended us indiegogo.com for the financial sources.We are planing this project for about 1 year. And now we found indiegogo.com, a chance to realize our project, for the first fime.We hope and believe strongly, that we achieve our goal. We need money to realize our project:

Domain&Hosting ( about 100 $ per year)


Design&Graphic (500$)


Seo(Search Machine optimization) ( 900 $) 


ChatServer, Webcam-Learn groups ( once 470$ after that 30$ monthly)

WebSite Security(SSL) ( 70$)
Webscripts, Advertising in different countries, (about 10.000$)
Translates( about 5000$)
We can start with 1000$  to build the website.
If we don't become at least 1000$ for the project, we will pay collected money, to any project, which could be useful for the students.When we achieve our aim, our last request from you is, to talk about this project, with your friends, neighbours etc. and it will be famous
If you help, this could be best known and most helpful learning platform for students.That must not be financial help, you can also help with your ideas.  If you know better solutions for this project, please share this with us.Thank you very much.

story:
Brief Summary 


We are a group of 5 students of the University of Geneva. Our humanitarian project aims to improve the quality of life of the 17 orphans of the HOPAD Children's Home orphanage, in Nepal, by providing them with the opportunity to receive a quality education.


Why do these children need us? 

The HOPAD Child and Women Promotion Society (Hopeless, Orphans, Poor, Affected, Dalits), a nepali certified NGO, has been working with orphans and helpless women since 2005. This NGO has a spotless reputation and a trusting relation with the nepali government and the Eris Academy, the children's school: http://www.hopadcwps.org.np.

In their Children Program, they focus on creating a loving and familiar environment for poor orphans. The main goal is to see them grow into smart, independent, rehabilitated, self driven individuals that will succeed in society as adults. Unfortunately, the NGO is currently in great financial difficulty; this is why we’d like to intervene and support them with this project.


What we need


We are trying to raise 3700 $(3500 CHF), 218 $ per child (200 CHF), in order to pay one school year for the 17 orphans !  

Every donation counts : 

Every child needs, 

  • 58 $ (55 CHF) : school material

  • 56$ (53 CHF) : school enrollment

  • 45 $ (42 CHF) : tutor

  • 38 $ (35 CHF) : uniform

  • 13 $ (10 CHF): governmental taxes (5%)

  • 8 $ (5 CHF) : exams fee 

We guarantee that the totality of the funds raised (even if we don’t reach or exceed our desirable sum) will go to the HOPAD Children's HOME to pay for their education.


The Impact


Conscious of our privilege of having access to a high quality education, we fight for a greater equity, that would allow all the children to have this fundamental right.

We truly believe that education is key in eradicating poverty. This children don't have parents to provide them with the basic right that is a basic education.

We care so much about this little ones and are ready to do everything it takes to achieve our objective.

We want to be as transparent as possible, that is why all our donors can ask us for more information (about the project, where their money goes, goals achieved, etc.) any time and without hesitation. We will post photos and details information about the children's school year on our website once we reach the necessary funds : http://the-lighthouse.wix.com/unige.

We do not limit ourselves by sharing our project on the internet, we also organize fundraising activities in our University in Geneva.


Risks and challenges


We’ve set up a deadline for collecting money, which is 10th of December. Therefore, our biggest challenge is to collect the required amount by this date. 


Other ways how you can help us


You can tell about our project to as many people as you can !!

You can also share ou Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Lighthouse/710471542376633?ref=bookmarks

Or tell people about our website : http://the-lighthouse.wix.com/unige !

Find out more about our little orphans : http://nepaliorphan.org. 

Do not hesitate to leave comments or questions.


**Thank you for your support !**

The Lighthouse Team 
The HOPAD Home Children : 
Anita, Bishal, Dev, Dandhevi, Diksha, Gress,  Jamuna, Kushum, Laxman, Misan, Padam, Prakash, Priya, Puspa, Sarada, Sima, Sisir

story:
Short Summary

This year YouthBuild McLean County celebrates 20 years of building a path out of poverty by empowering young people to complete their education, develop leadership skills, obtain job training, and build affordable housing.  These young people have been labeled at-risk, troubled, and low-income, but we call them Opportunity Youth.  Given the opportunity and the tools, they can build a better future for their families and their community.

In partnership with the ISU School of Theatre and Dance's MFA Actors we want to explore our 20-year history in the words of our young people, alumni, and partners.  There is little more empowering than honestly exploring your history, envisioning your future, and telling your story.  Together we will write and edit a new script, and bring it to life on a stage of our own construction.


What We Need & What You Get

We've secured grants for a director, and have sent out grants for designers to teach the students about their trade and help them bring the world of the play to life.  We've stashed away funds for essentials and operating costs, but no grant will fund the snacks and activities that will allow the creative juices to flow during our research and writing sessions. 

We want to raise $500 to provide healthy snacks and activities that introduce the arts, and build trust and facilitate conversation between the YouthBuild students and the MFA Actors who will be the lead "Researchers".  

We won't forget those donors who help make this project a reality.  As a 501(c)(3), your donation to YouthBuild may be tax deductible!

  • All donors will be recognized in the program of our final production, and will receive monthly updates on our activities.
  • For a donation of $10 we'll send you a signed photograph of a YouthBuild student enjoying the treat you've provided.
  • For a donation of $25 we'll send you a set of 5 handmade holiday cards that you can use to give your own thanks this season.
  • For a donation of $50 we'll send you one of our show shirts signed by all of the students whose lives you've changed by your gift.


The Impact

YouthBuild students:

  • Are over 70% low-income;
  • Enter our high school with an average reading level of 6th grade and an average math level of 4th grade; and
  • Face social and economic barriers to success they cannot overcome alone.

YouthBuild students:

  • Increase math and reading skills by a minimum of two grade levels in a year;
  • Complete a diploma, GED, or job readiness certificate at a rate of 90% of program completers;
  • Individually contribute more than 675 hours of community service to area schools, food banks, non-profits, and on the construction of safe and affordable housing;
  • Collectively contributed over 500,000 hours of community service in our 20-year history; and
  • Have gone on from YouthBuild to open their own businesses, earn masters degrees, buy or build their own homes, introduce Colin Powell, build with First Lady Michelle Obama, and much more.
Doesn't this sound like a story worth telling?


Meeting (or exceeding) Our Goal

If we meet our goal of $500 we'll be launching into story circles, one on one interviews, and fact gathering in December.  We plan for a writing period in the spring of 2015 and a final production early fall 2015. 

If we exceed our goal we'll put any additional funds into YouthBuild's Student Needs Fund.  This fund supports students in need for things like medical needs (e.g. dental work and eyeglasses), emergency transportation, food, and shelter assistance, college application fee and testing assistance,


Thank You For Your Support!


We are YouthBuild, We do make the difference.

story:
Our Mission:

We are traveling to the Shree Himalayan Primary School in Namche Bazaar, a town high up in the Everest region of Nepal. Because it is so difficult to access this area of Nepal, school materials are in high demand and short supply. Our goal is to travel to the region to meet the students and teachers, and trek in some of these much needed supplies.

Because there are no roads in this part of the mountains, many children commute long hours from neighboring towns to attend school. To address the needs of the children who trek farthest, the school runs a boarding house called Our Home Away From Home. This boarding house takes care of the children, some as young as 4, while they attend school during the week. Our aid will help finance the boarding of children whose parents cannot afford it.

Nepal is not a rich country. Many of these children's parents are subsistence farmers and laborers, and some risk their lives guiding Westerners up into the mountains. Some are orphans who have lost their Sherpa fathers on the slopes of Everest.  We want to bring them some aid, and some joy, and help ensure their learning is not hampered by a lack of supplies.

What We Need:


Your donations will be used to buy an assortment of crucial school supplies, including pencils, chalk, crayons, pencil pouches, paper and other needs such as soap, toothpaste and games for the kids. We will set aside whatever funding is leftover after these purchases to give as a cash gift to the school. Your impact on the school will be documented in a film we are making about our trip.

Who We Are:

We are a husband and wife team. Tess Finnigan-Allen is a science teacher at the Ethical Culture Fieldston School in the Bronx. Owen Strock is a documentary filmmaker. We will be traveling to Nepal to bring aid to the schools and to make a documentary about the struggles of the Nepali people, showing the dangers faced by Sherpas for the sake of Western adventurers. We will spend 3 weeks traveling in the mountains, meeting and interviewing Sherpas, and a week at the schools in Namche Bazaar, documenting the lives and struggles of the children.

Other Ways You Can Help:

For those that can't give, please consider sharing this campaign with your friends and family. Use the share tools on the left side of the screen to help publicize our campaign via email, Facebook, Twitter and beyond! Every little bit helps.

THANK YOU for all you do!

- Tess And Owen

story:
Summary

What we have now

We created a series of 18 Games for K-Children to prepare for a lot of tasks before they enter Grade 1. These games are split in four categories: movement, ordering, sounds, and comprehension.

Movement: Games to detect how quick objects, colors or shapes are recognized. A left or right game.

Ordering: Games to find out how good a child is in ordering numbers, letters and days of the week.

Sounds: Games to test our ears on rhyming and starting sounds.

Comprehension: Games to see how much children already learned to read. Games that will guide young children into reading easy words.

What Will They Learn in Kindergarten?

Our children learn a lot these days in Kindergarten:

·  Recognize and form uppercase and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

·  Match sounds to each alphabet letter.

·  Recognize and use rhyming words.

·  Begin reading words

·  Count, recognize, and write the numbers up to 20.

·  Identify, draw, cut, and name squares, circles, triangles, ovals, diamonds, and rectangles.

·  Classify and group objects according to such characteristics as shape, color, size, texture, and so on.

(Source by Family Education Staff)

The challenge

We are developing these Games in an interactive all-American sports environment to make the attractive to our children.

More importantly, we want to give all moms and dads, all educators the chance to find out, secretly, how much our children already learned to be ready for Grade 1.

The results of these Games will enable you to find out more about the challenges of your children without stigmatizing them for the whole class. Nobody has to know if your child has Dyslexia or ADD, but it is good to know.

It is good to know that your child has picked up enough words, that its hand-eye coordination is good, etc.

All these can be found after completing the 18 Games, and you may do the Games again a couple of months later to see the improvements of your child.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $50,000 to make the Games available to all the new media: tablets, touch screen PC's and laptops with IOS, OSX, Android, and all Windows platforms. 

Pledge $ 10 or more and get 1 time free test

Pledge $ 20 or more and get 1 free test and 1 free evaluation mail

Pledge $ 50 or more and get 2 tests and evaluation by mail and phone

Pledge $100 or more and get 5 tests and evaluation by mail and phone

Pledge $ 250 or more and receive the Reading & Learning program and 15 free tests

Pledge $ 1,000 or more and receive unlimited free testing for two years and the 50 installations reading of the reading & learning program

The Impact

According to the National Institute of Child and Human development, 15% of Americans have major troubles with reading. 15% i.e. more than 47 million US citizens.

We have been doing research on dyslexia for almost 20 years now and, according to studies at both Stanford and Rutgers, if dyslexia were detected at a very early stage, in 80% of the cases the brain could rewire itself and correct the learning problem.  These studies have proven that, after intensive training of the young child, parts of the brain rewired missing links. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides funds, we are also in need for this:

We need people to share this to get the word out. There are a lot of people struggling with reading who don't know about it or are to afraid to share their issues with the community. We need you to reach out! 


    Thanks you for reading. We hope you all can help.

Be sure to check out our website!
http://www.pathwaystolearningsoftware.com/home.html

story:
We are a family from Albuquerque, New Mexico that has been privately funding a school in a highly impoverished area of Pakistan for about a year. Philanthropy and community issues have always been an important part of our lives. Over the years we have found ourselves helping in orphanages in Mexico, our dad is a contractor who went to Kosovo for many months to rebuild homes after they were bombed, we worked in foster care and adopted two kids into our home and now we find our hearts longing to help these children in Pakistan.

Tibba is located at a distance of 20km towards North of main Okara city. There are about 300 Christian families living in this rural area. In Pakistan, Christians are a minority and looked down upon. They are often degraded and met with violence and are not allowed to hold higher positions in government. Because of their choice of religion they do not receive help. They often walk on eggshells because they can be prosecuted if someone makes the claim (usually for blackmail or revenge) that they said something offensive about the Muslim religion. The majority of the Christians live in misery and are discriminated against on a regular basis.

The area is a rich agricultural part of the country and different types of products are grown here. Many of the villagers work in the fields of their landlords for very little pay which is hardly sufficient to run their families. When they need money for their urgent needs it is borrowed from their landlords. As it is hard to return the money this debt is transferred to their children and they remain slaves for generations. All of them basically belong to a labor class. There has not been a single school in the area for this huge mass, so the boys and girls have preferred to go and help their parents in the fields or to nearby market where they lift heavy loads on their backs to earn extra scraps.

 There is no medical unit working in this area by the government. There is no first aid. Many women die due to improper medical treatment.  The child death rate in infants and newborns is very high due to lack of any medical help. As the people are very poor, it is hard for them to get to the city quickly to save their lives without a vehicle. Their common mode of transportation is a donkey cart.

The future of a nation is directly linked with the new generation. The children are the greatest asset of this community. If we can help them get an education we can give them hope for a better future. Education is the first step to helping people so that they can better take care of themselves. Their parents would love for them to get an education but they can't even consider it while they don't even have food and clothing. It has been our good fortune to identify that need and be able to fill it, but we are only one family and we need your help.

The very first picture in our video above is of a little boy. That particular little boy wandered the streets for weeks playing with different children during the day before people were able to identify that he was an orphan and could get him into a home. That is the kind of experience that is common in this rural village. Christmas, Easter and other Christian festivals are a dream. Small things that we take for granted on a daily basis are luxuries for them.

Our goal this Christmas is to give these children coats to keep them warm in the cold and provide them with a little cake and tea to have a small celebration. Please help us give to these children something that will greatly benefit their health and their spirits. Be a part of an act of kindness that will make an incredible difference in the lives of these young children by being an example of love, religious tolerance, compassion and faith in their ability to grow into great men and women who can also make a difference in the world for good.

If you can not give please share this to all that you know so that someone who may have the resources and heart for this cause can help.
story_txt:
We are a family from Albuquerque, New Mexico that has been
privately funding a school in a highly impoverished area of Pakistan for about
a year. Philanthropy and community issues have always been an important part of
our lives. Over the years we have found ourselves helping in orphanages in
Mexico, our dad is a contractor who went to Kosovo for many months to rebuild
homes after they were bombed, we worked in foster care and adopted two kids
into our home and now we find our hearts longing to help these children in
Pakistan.
Tibba is
located at a distance of 20km towards North of main Okara city. There are about
300 Christian families living in this rural area. In Pakistan, Christians are a minority and
looked down upon. They are often degraded and met with violence and are
not allowed to hold higher positions in government. Because of their choice of
religion they do not receive help. They often walk on eggshells because they
can be prosecuted if someone makes the claim (usually for blackmail or revenge)
that they said something offensive about the Muslim religion. The majority of
the Christians live in misery and are discriminated against on a regular basis.
The area is a rich agricultural part of the country and
different types of products are grown here. Many of the villagers work in
the fields of their landlords for very little pay which is hardly sufficient to
run their families. When they need money for their urgent needs it is borrowed
from their landlords. As it is hard to return the money this debt is
transferred to their children and they remain slaves for generations. All of
them basically belong to a labor class. There has not been a single school in
the area for this huge mass, so the boys and girls have preferred to go and
help their parents in the fields or to nearby market where they lift heavy
loads on their backs to earn extra scraps.
 There is no
medical unit working in this area by the government. There is no first aid.
Many women die due to improper medical treatment.  The child death rate in infants and newborns is very high
due to lack of any medical help. As the people are very poor, it is hard for
them to get to the city quickly to save their lives without a vehicle. Their
common mode of transportation is a donkey cart. 
The
future of a nation is directly linked with the new generation. The children are
the greatest asset of this community. If we can help them get an education we
can give them hope for a better future. Education is the first step to helping
people so that they can better take care of themselves. Their parents would
love for them to get an education but they can't even consider it while they
don't even have food and clothing. It has been our good fortune to identify
that need and be able to fill it, but we are only one family and we need your
help.The very first picture in our video above is of a little
boy. That particular little boy wandered the streets for weeks playing with
different children during the day before people were able to identify that he
was an orphan and could get him into a home. That is the kind of experience
that is common in this rural village. Christmas, Easter and other Christian
festivals are a dream. Small things that we take for granted on a daily basis
are luxuries for them. 
Our goal this Christmas is to give these children coats to
keep them warm in the cold and provide them with a little cake and tea to have
a small celebration. Please help us give to these children something that will
greatly benefit their health and their spirits. Be a part of an act of kindness
that will make an incredible difference in the lives of these young children by
being an example of love, religious tolerance, compassion and faith in their
ability to grow into great men and women who can also make a difference in the
world for good.
If you can not give please share this to all that you know
so that someone who may have the resources and heart for this cause can help.

story:
When was the last time you heared nothing but the sound of leaves in the wind?


We are students and members of Knowmads Business School Amsterdam, an alternative school for entrepreneurs, who bring positive change into the world. 


Changing Ourselves

Before changing the outside world, we want to start with the inside, with ourselves first. So, we will go on a 10 day trip into a nature reserve in Spain, of which we will spend 3 days and nights alone, fasting, only with a sleeping bag and a tarp. It will be an experience to deepen our learning, to connect back to nature and to feel what our gifts are which we can bring to the people and community around us.


Originally Nature or Vision Quest comes from a Native American tradition, when teenagers used to spend one to four days and nights alone in the nature. This time marking the transition between childhood and full acceptance into adulthood was thought to bring profound insights about oneself and the world.



Why do we need you?

To make this journey financially possible, we want to reach out to you. Next to the money we already earned with projects, workshops and events, we need another € 4.000 in order to pay for the facilitators who will guide us through this deep process, and for food, shelter and transportation. 

If you can not contribute financially, you can still support us by sharing the campaign with your friends and network. Please note: for every share on facebook, twitter, email google+ or other platforms, our network will plant one tree in Brazil! Just let us know on how many platforms you shared our campaign and we will do the rest. F.ex.: If you share on facebook, twitter and google+, 3 trees will be planted.


Your support will bring a great contribution to each of us, by making it possible to go on this life-changing journey.



What do YOU get?

We are a group of changemakers from 6 different countries and with the most diverse backgrounds. This is your opportunity to get in touch with us for inspiring gifts, creative dinners, upshaking brainstormings, to (co-)create workshops or whatever you can imagine. If you want to request a perk which we didn't offer, please get in touch with us and we will investigate what we can do for you!


   Dror: "Nature Quest is an opportunity to have a look
                                   inside of ourselves and letting nature empower our
                                   process."


Chris: "Through the Nature Quest, I hope to gain clarity on how 
to combine my goals with personal strengths and wishes for my life."

                                                                                                  


  Pieter: "For me our Nature Quest is a time to reflect
                                    on my life, to get more encouragement and resources
                                    to go on more engaged as I try to do now."

                                                                                

Marco: "For me, Nature Quest is a place to be in the present, and be the
detective of myself, I will know myself better and find what am i really hungry for."

                                                                                                

   Jord: "A Nature Quest is a deep personal challenge.
                                     I want to find out my next steps about Leadership."


Daniel: "Nature Quest is a confrontation in nature. To learn more about
why you do things, and to get insights on what has value in life."
                                                                                               


   Ugne: "For me the Nature Quest is a mystery. I want
                                     to get the feeling that it is also possible to live differently."


Loli: "Nature Quest for me is an opportunity to see beyond my
mind, so I can give that to those who surround me."
                                                                                                

   Monique: "Nature Quest for me is slowing down.
                                     Being closer to my own energy so I can work from that."

story:
The Rossfechten Symposium


(Björn Kiefer one of our instructors, training celtic cavalry techniques with a gladiator group in Trier Germany)

We have the chance to create a truly historic event, the first of it's kind, combining some of the most challenging disciplines in existence, riding, martial arts and historical research. Fifteenth century German fencing manuals call the art of combat on horseback Rossfechten. This means not just fighting on horseback but horse and rider fighting as one. To return this to life is our ultimate goal.  We are a group of  HEMAists (Historical European Martial Artists)   accomplished riders and re-enactors who are passionate about reconstructing mounted combat from period sources in the interest of better understanding our history and heritage. We welcome every one of you to attend, but understand that not everyone can. If you would love to come but cannot  please make  this possible for others. Your donations can make this event successful and
most importantly annual so we can hope to see you in the future. You can take our event from obsure and academic to EPIC!


(Folio 55r of the Königswald version of Talhoffer)

Our event website

What does your money go to

(Landgestüt Zweibrücken)

We are all scholars, riders, fencers, re-enactors or a combination of the three and our wallets are not as extensive as our devotion to our goal. Traveling with horses doubles the costs for those already donating their time. Our instructors have already agreed to work for free, and many are  flying internationally. We unfortunately cannot cover costs purely with participation fees. To make an affordable event that people like you can come, enjoy and learn from, we need your help.

 We have the chance to upgrade to the Landesgestüt Zweibrücken, a stud farm founded by Napoleon himself, right outside Zweibrücken’s city-centre with riding facilities perfect for our needs.Your money will pay for the location we have been offered, the owners have already bent over backwards offering it for a fraction of the price it usually goes for as they to want to see this succeed. We are confident we can handle the rest of the costs. With this venue we can take more participants and reach more people. Our event will be running at the same time as the city fair, which annually pulls more than a hundred thousand attendees, allowing us to reach the largest amount of people possible. This will help us further our goal of educating people about these little known martial and equestrian arts. And even more awesome,  find more like-minded souls such as yourselves to swell our ranks.  And that will ensure this event is only the beginning.

Stretch goals

If we meet our goal of two thousand Euros we can start with the things that otherwise would be wishful thinking.

2800

With an extra 800 Euro we can film the workshops, demonstrations and presentations and make them available for you

Over 2800

Every cent over 2800 goes into bringing instructors who otherwise financially cannot attend. To have even more prominent people giving us their input will put us effectively a year ahead of the game.

Your impact

(Folio 7v of the Munich version of Talhoffer)

Our academics, fencers and riders have achieved great things in isolation, now it is time to meet and take it to the next level and to share what knowledge we have gathered, in the form of workshops, lectures and demonstrations. It is of utmost importance to us that we make our passion accessible to everyone. 

Much effort and dedication has been put in planning  a great event. We need you to bring it to the next level. We have the chance to create a truly historic event, the first of it's kind, with some of the top riders, academics and swordsmen in the world. Donate and you become  a part of making that happen.

Our ultimate goal is to build a community of like-minded enthusiasts across the globe. Join us now and become part of that community.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t donate you can help us other ways.  Share on facebook or other social media. Send a link per email to a friend. Let a history, fencing or riding forum know about us. Spread the word

If you want to become a part of our effort or have questions or interested in finding in people who share your interest, feel free to send an Email or join us on social media.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/159375070887341/?ref=ts&fref=ts

(One of our instructors, Julia Thut practicing mounted Combat with Felix Stampfli, foto by Hanne Bratholm)

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Greetings I am Horane Brown an Entrepreneur with years of experience of being involved in the Jamaican sports industry. It has been my dream to attend the upcoming Sports Management Worldwide Conference Friday and Saturday, February 21 & 22, 2014. The reason is to open the doors in sports management from a Jamaican perspective through building new connections.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds will be used for air travel, accommodation and event registration. You can give the amount that you can afford. 

The Impact

The impact of me going to this conference is going to great for Jamaica. I will be able to do more deals for Jamaican athletes. In the long run you will have a Jamaican sports management company representing Jamaicans and growing the Jamaican economy.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant support with cash you can spread the word to others that can help.

story:
We're a group of Vietnameses who are bout to enter one of the toughest challenges on earth: "THE TOUGH MUDDER EVENT" (http://toughmudder.com/).

For a taste of what it might be like, you can watch what happened last year here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ObcX5ZopSZE&feature=player_embedded

We hope to make use of this opportunity to raise awareness about the unfortunate STREET kids throughout Vietnam. Our goal is to raise a $1,000USD fund to support the BLUE DRAGON CHILDREN'S FOUNDATION (http://www.facebook.com/pages/Blue-Dragon-Child...) by SUNDAY, JULY 15, 2012, which is also the day of the challenge at Mount Snow, Vermont, New England, U.S.A.

story:
About the orphanage:

Grace Community Children's Home is a non-governmental organization that deals with orphans, street children and any other children who are neglected by their relatives. 

The small building is made of corrugated iron sheets, and houses 102 children, from the ages of 2 months to 18 years old.

It offers basic shelter and food for the children, and is run by a single 27-year old man, Richard. The children all help with cooking and cleaning, incredibly grateful if they manage to have a meal every day.

Looking to achieve:

In December we are hoping to achieve the following:

  • Discuss the possibility of setting up better bigger accommodation space and help them with their current costs
  • Look at how we can support the teaching and education long term and provide suitable resources in the meanwhile
  • Providing clothes and basic bedding/hygiene materials

Future:

The long term plan is to look into how we may possibly be able to help them to establish a small business. 

Thank you very much :)

Registration charity number:1107952

story:
About Us:  

My name is Kyle Williams and I teach 6th grade math and science at the wonderful Warren G. Harding Middle School located in Philadelphia, PA.  My teammate, Jackie Rubinsky, teaches special education.  Here at Warren G. Harding Middle School, we strive to create an atmosphere where students and adults come together as one and be as successful as they can be.  We are all very excited for the upcoming 2015-2016 school year to start and we are looking into providing more opportunities for students to continue their education outside of the school hours.  Our students need clubs, sports, and other programs that will expand their minds and to get involved in ways they didn't think possible.  

We were once students where people stated, "they are the future."  Our students are the future now.  Let's make sure it continues to be a bright one.  

Campaign Mission:

I started teaching in the Philadelphia public education system in 2009.  I remember my first day as a middle school teacher as if it were yesterday.  Seven years and three schools later, I still get super excited for a new school year to start.  However, as the days get closer for the first day with students, I am hit by reality and realize that our district is in a financial turmoil, the students do not come to school with basic supplies, and students start off the school year 3-5 years below grade average in reading and math skills.  Here at Warren G. Harding Middle School, every student is eligible for free lunches due to their socioeconomic status.  The poverty level for the community is relatively high and many students come to school not having the opportunity to have eaten a healthy breakfast.  

We want to bring to the students the "well-rounded education" that we had the great privilege of receiving when we were their age.  We want to start after school programs, make sure that all students have supplies, and make sure that my fellow colleagues have supplies for success as well.  

They say it takes  a village to raise a child.  Well, that's where you come in.  I have spent over $500 dollars already out of my own pocket.  I have bought backpacks, school supplies, and even have furnished two iPads for the students.  The students at Warren G. Harding Middle School need your help and support to make sure that each of them are prepared for success.  We need you to be apart of our "village" and help us in achieving success this year.  

Goal:

Our goal is to raise $8000!  The money would go straight into after school program needs (clubs, sports, tutoring, educational trips), school supplies (paper, pencils, winter jackets, backpacks, binders, etc), and possibly an iPad for up to 15 teachers (iPads would be used by both students and teachers.  There are amazing apps I already have on mine that students utilize for research and teacher apps that allows our job to monitor faster and easier and be more effective).  


Again, it takes a village.  Our village needs you!
story_txt: About Us:  My name is Kyle Williams and I teach 6th grade math and science at the wonderful Warren G. Harding Middle School located in Philadelphia, PA.  My teammate, Jackie Rubinsky, teaches special education.  Here at Warren G. Harding Middle School, we strive to create an atmosphere where students and adults come together as one and be as successful as they can be.  We are all very excited for the upcoming 2015-2016 school year to start and we are looking into providing more opportunities for students to continue their education outside of the school hours.  Our students need clubs, sports, and other programs that will expand their minds and to get involved in ways they didn't think possible.  We were once students where people stated, "they are the future."  Our students are the future now.  Let's make sure it continues to be a bright one.  Campaign Mission:I started teaching in the Philadelphia public education system in 2009.  I remember my first day as a middle school teacher as if it were yesterday.  Seven years and three schools later, I still get super excited for a new school year to start.  However, as the days get closer for the first day with students, I am hit by reality and realize that our district is in a financial turmoil, the students do not come to school with basic supplies, and students start off the school year 3-5 years below grade average in reading and math skills.  Here at Warren G. Harding Middle School, every student is eligible for free lunches due to their socioeconomic status.  The poverty level for the community is relatively high and many students come to school not having the opportunity to have eaten a healthy breakfast.  We want to bring to the students the "well-rounded education" that we had the great privilege of receiving when we were their age.  We want to start after school programs, make sure that all students have supplies, and make sure that my fellow colleagues have supplies for success as well.  They say it takes  a village to raise a child.  Well, that's where you come in.  I have spent over $500 dollars already out of my own pocket.  I have bought backpacks, school supplies, and even have furnished two iPads for the students.  The students at Warren G. Harding Middle School need your help and support to make sure that each of them are prepared for success.  We need you to be apart of our "village" and help us in achieving success this year.  Goal:Our goal is to raise $8000!  The money would go straight into after school program needs (clubs, sports, tutoring, educational trips), school supplies (paper, pencils, winter jackets, backpacks, binders, etc), and possibly an iPad for up to 15 teachers (iPads would be used by both students and teachers.  There are amazing apps I already have on mine that students utilize for research and teacher apps that allows our job to monitor faster and easier and be more effective).  Again, it takes a village.  Our village needs you!

story:
Short Summary

I work as a visual artist and theatre director in Toronto, Canada.  Over the past several years I have been  working with both visual and theatre artists in Santiago de Cuba.  It has become very clear to me that Cuban artists have a wealth of talent but lack resources. Hurricane Sandy, 2012, has made the procuring of art materials even more difficult. With a remarkably small amount of money we can make a big difference here in Canada.

Hurricane Sandy, 2012, has made the procuring of art materials even more difficult. With a remarkably small amount of money we can make a big difference here in Canada.

story:
We are asking you to please make monetary donations to help us build our program.  Any donations received are tax deductible (EIN#: 22-2990908) and will be used toward the following:

- To purchase annual program materials for each NEW team.

- To replace lost, broken, or unusable parts and invest in other needed program materials.

- To expand our Jr.FLL program to all of St. Croix Valley area.

- To create the next program level (FIRST Lego League [FLL]) for Jr.FLL participants to transition to.

- To create a small discretionary fund (fees waived for families with little or no income, admin/paper/printing costs, publicity, registration, etc.)

- To help train new volunteer coaches and mentors.

- To organize and execute the operation of the Lego Leagues, the Spring EXPO and Lego FUN Fest and other community activities.

- To create a self-sustaining organization for students, without adding to their families the burden of mandated fundraising for our programs on top of paying the annual fee to participate.

Thank You!

ORGANIZATION DESCRIPTION:

Jr. FIRST Lego League (Jr.FLL) is a new-to-our-area extracurricular activity for kids in the St. Croix Valley.  We currently have 12 teams (74 kids, grades JK - 4th) and 11 coaches participating in this year's program!

Jr.FLL is a national and international program.  Each year the kids are divided into teas of 6 and given a real world challenge to research and solve using LEGO parts.

"In the 2013 DISASTER BLASTER℠ Challenge, over 22,000 children from 12 countries will explore the awe-inspiring storms, quakes, waves and more that we call natural disasters.  Teams will learn how science, technology, engineering, and math impact our everyday lives while they get excited about future innovations..."

Participants share what they've learned and the project models they build with the community at the Spring EXPO.  The Community is invited to participate in part of the EXPO during Lego Fun Fest, where they join us in family-oriented, fun activity stations appropriate for all ages and ABILITIES.

 

For more information about the National programs visit:

http://www.usfirst.org/roboticsprograms/jr.fll

http://www.firstlegoleague.org/

story:
Short Summary

Srey Pov is an amazing young woman from Cambodia.  Both her parents died of aids and she was at huge risk for trafficking at the time of her rescue. While she was at a children's center in Poi Pet she worked hard to catch up on the school years she missed and became the much loved big sister of every child in the center, helping in all the mother tasks needed to take care of the children. I am so very proud to know her.

Srey Pov is still at serious risk, in some ways now more then ever. She is beautiful and now seventeen years old. Without a career and a way to support herself she is in danger of exploitation and sexual abuse. We have found her a home near the capital with a loving mother who is raising two adopted special needs children. Srey Pov is very happy to be in that home and be a big sister again.

However, we are currently looking for extra funds for her to finish high school. She has managed to get to grade 10 despite her serious set backs as a young girl. She wants to be a teacher. In order to give her the best chance of access to post-secondary education and to be the amazing teacher I know she can be I'd like to send her to a good quality school.

If you could donate even a little to this next school year, you'll be making a dream come true for a couragous and beauty-heart of a young women as well as securing her future saftey!

 

What We Need & What You Get

What does $1000 do for our friend?

* She gets a few school uniforms complete with shoes and backpacks (required to be in school in Cambodia)

* She gets tuition for a year to a private school, ($50/month) which insures good quality education for a female and ensures she's getting the right education to apply for post-secondary schoolling

* She gets all the textbooks, notebooks, and school supplies she needs to learn

* She gets transporation to and from school

What happens if the whole funds are not raised? All the money will still be sent to the organization managing her care who will make sure she still gets an education once all the money comes in. Even if it takes time, we know it will happen. But it'd be great if she didn't have to wait any longer and if she could have the best there is!

What happens if clothes or text books end up being cheaper than the above costs? What happens to left over money? Well, we don't anticipate there being extra but if there were, it would go into the fund for the next year of schooling for Srey Pov.

We can't offer goods or return of money, but we can offer you updates on her story so you can feel a part of her community of friends!

 

The Impact

First, you've reached out and made a safer and better life possible for a young women whose already overcome increadable hardship, a young woman with the kindness and worth ethnic needed to reach her own goals.

Second, you're helping to provide a country in desperate need of excellent and loving educators with a teacher who loves children and who will be a person who brings positive change to desperate circumstance.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give, please share using the tools this website provides!

story:
Hello,

 

My name is Andrea J. Lee and i am a single mother of three beautiful children. My mission and goal in life is to give back to society by speaking and educating women and teenagers all across the globe by reaching them in a way that has never been done before.

Single Ladies put a cap on it will shed the light on celibacy, promiscuity, sexual abuse, the rapid growth of AIDS and h.i.v. and the statistics, why we have so many single parent households. I will also decribe the behavior patterns of an sexually abused women and the signs to look for, i will also define the term "jump off", i will ask women to self identify and show them a way out of that lifestyle by giving them the steps and the tools they need to do it.

This book will be a great gift for any teenager.

story:
My story

My name is Julianna and I was accepted by Youth For Understanding USA (YFU) for a semester study abroad program. YFU is a local, non-profit, high school youth and family based organization. The exchange strives to make the world a smaller place by dispelling cultural stereotypes.  The participants travel, meet new people, and experience new things to change people's views on not only the world, but themselves. This is part of my motivation to experience this exchange opportunity.

I will be traveling to Australia or New Zealand and staying for five months with a YFU selected family. My departure date will be sometime in late January of 2014 and I will be returning in late June of 2014. While there, I will be attending the local high school for a semester of my junior year. Once there I will be immersed in the language, culture, history, and the community of my host family and country. I hope to bring back an appreciation for other cultures, an expanded tolerance of differences, and lifelong friends and family.

I am asking for a financial donation to help defray the cost of this venture. The total cost of this exchange trip will cost $13, 495. I need to raise approximately $13,000 to cover the balance of the program fees and additional incidental expenses while I am overseas. Textbooks, school fees, and transportation to school are not included in the tuition and will vary depending on where I am placed. 

A donation of any amount that you can contribute will be greatly appreciated. You can also help by spreading the word. Again any money that I raise will be used solely to help pay for my necessary school expenses and other costs while on program abroad. 

Thank you for your consideration and support.

story:
Maybe you’ve heard of us, maybe you haven’t; regardless, we want to be the organization you can’t stop talking about. We may be a small team working with a tight budget, but we’re proud of the education that has become accessible to our students in the Asiafo Amanfro Community in Ghana, Africa.

THE FACTS:

The Akaa Project was founded in 2009 with the establishment of the Asiafo Amanfro Community School.

We are located in the Eastern Region of Ghana, known for its mountainous, rural, farming villages.

Our school’s attendance has grown every year, enrolling over 100 students in the beginning of this 5th school year.

Our school has inspired neighboring communities of Hasi, Bosotwi, and Suta (the closest of which is a half mile away) to send their children to our school where they can rely on the teachers, facilities, and quality of education.  

THE ISSUE:

In the past we have made several attempts to hire local tro-tros (buses) and drivers to act as our school bus to increase attendance from the neighboring communities.

Each student was paying the equivalent of $.30 a week to be picked up by a driver who may or may not show up and is most often causing the students to arrive late to class.

The cost of hiring the tro-tro has more than doubled due to drastic increases in the price of petrol in Ghana.

For the last three weeks of the 2013-2014 academic year, our students were forced to either walk to school, with many older students carrying their younger siblings, or not attend at all.

The walk to school has completely altered the effectiveness of the school day by interfering with scheduling, student engagement, and overall class attendance.

THE SOLUTION:

It’s time the Akaa Project invested in its very own school transportation!

What do we need? $15,000 for the overall costs of buying, insuring, and operating a 15-20 person tro-tro (essentially a large van).

What can we do with it? The most basic and valuable uses will be purely to increase consistent school attendance, but it will also hugely expand the range of our life-skill development activities through regular field trips and excursions to give our students a better understanding of the opportunities available to them in Ghana. Furthermore, it will allow us to collaborate with and engage volunteers in our mission.

Reliable transportation also has the ability to increase the speed and effectiveness of many Akaa Project initiatives that frequently rely on the shipping and delivery of resources and materials.

story:
BREAKING NEWS: Stephen Fry shows ongoing support & donates generously -again - over £2000 to SAVE Rainbow Jews!! 

With Stephen's great help, we have now reached our target & saved Rainbow Jews! THANK YOU,on behalf of ALL Rainbow Jews, you're a real MENSCH!

Thank you, everyone! 

The campaign is still open for another 2 days - please keep donating - we will deliver that's our commitment to the cause and to you - and we can do so much more.

More media support: Jewish News UK http://bit.ly/1uBQV09 http://bit.ly/1BBgVMa ; USA: http://bit.ly/1sadN5D ; So So Gay  http://bit.ly/1CN0g95 

There is a story which should not be lost.' (Reni, 90, Leicester, Rainbow Jews interviewee & supporter)
This is your opportunity to support a truly unique heritage project and ensure its survival. 
CAMPAIGN EXTENDED - FINAL DAYS - LAST CHANCE - FINAL DAYS
Please donate right now - whatever you can - so we can keep going in 2014 and further on! ThankYou Perks are waiting for you. :)  EVERY LITTLE HELPS

Who We are

Rainbow Jews is a pioneering project that records and showcases Jewish lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) history from the 1950s to today. For the first time ever in British history, it captures the voices and experiences of Jewish LGBT people in the UK through oral histories and archive creation.

Read more about this celebrated initiative, its historic exhibition launch for London LGBT History Month 2014, and the archive collection opening at the London Metropolitan Archives in May 2014, here: Rainbow Jews LGBT History Project

Rainbow Jews has numerous supporters and followers in and outside Britain, and even Stephen Fry got behind the landmark #rjexhibition launch via Twitter:

More clips, oral histories and photos can be found here, click via our Indigogo campaign Gallery (top of left tab), or via our Website or RJ You Tube Channel.

Why We Need You

Rainbow Jews is a volunteer-led initiative, hosted by the charity Liberal Judaism, and was so far supported generously by the Lottery Heritage Fund; the 2-year one-off grant has now finished. With the current cuts in public funding we need further aid from other sources to continue our work. We believe in your community spirit - and in Rainbow Jews, and we want to keep making a difference. Now we ask you, our friends and supporters, to help us make this legacy go on.

How Will The Money Be Spent?

If we raise £5000, we will be able to cover some core costs during our UK mini tour until November 2014. Your donation will help us to: 

- cover staff costs for a part-time project manager, who will coordinate the volunteers, and continue to promote our key activities, such as:

- getting this wonderful exhibition around the country so that we can further share these amazing stories and experiences, (We have already confirmed Leicester, Birmingham and Liverpool/Homotopia as from 31 August 2014; with more possibilities e.g. Belfast).

- create over 5 events such as launch receptions, film screenings and talks while touring.

- disseminate our education resources, and co-facilitate sessions at school, youth groups etc.

- recording and processing of over 10 new oral histories, especially of Jewish LGBT pioneers in remoter UK regions.

- collecting more memorabilia and fostering our archive collection at LMA.

If we raise less than £5000, we will do our best to achieve as many of our goals as possible. So far we have raised the costs for the Rainbow Jews exhibition in Leicester thanks to generous donors of Leicester’s Jewish & LGBT community and friends.

What happens over £5000?

If we reach our goal of £5000 that will be amazing. If we can raise funds over this amount, we'll be able to do even more. The charity Liberal Judaism will ensure that the money is used sensibly after November 2014, and for years to come, to:

- cover expenses for Rainbow Jews volunteers and volunteer training.

- nurture and grow our archive collection at LMA.

- continue touring the RJ exhibition (e.g. Limmud Conference Warwick 2014, Brighton for LGBT History Month 2015)

- keep organising regular community/awareness events (e.g. Brighton launch).

- keep educating the wider community about J-LGBT issues (e.g. produce toolkit)

- sustain the Rainbow Jews Website, social media channels, and promote the initiative globally.

What You Get

There are different perks for different donation levels. You can check out the perks on the right side of this page. Not your thing? We are always happy to listen, and you can of course opt out of the rewards scheme in case you feel that saving Rainbow Jews is already enough of an incentive :).

Who's Making This? 

Rainbow Jews is run by the wonderful team of the charity Liberal Judaism, and has been going on for almost two years because of the tireless efforts of one person, manager and founder Surat, and a growing community of dedicated volunteers and supporters. Find out about our team - click here

 Why is Rainbow Jews so important?

"I am honoured to support Rainbow Jews and to celebrate the huge positive contribution that Jewish people make to the LGBT community and to our wider society. Jewish and LGBT people share many parallels of oppression and of triumph over adversity. As victims of prejudice, it is important for us to stand together united against all hate."  (Peter Tatchell, human rights veteran) 

"Rainbow Jews provides an important source of Jewish history. I urge people to get involved and support this project in whichever way they can" (Rabbi Danny Rich, CEO Liberal Judaism)

“Rainbow Jews doesn’t just reflect LGBT history, it reflects over 50 years of British and world Jewry, We’ve heard stories going back even further than the Holocaust, from diaspora across the continents. Identities are multifaceted, and this project shows the interconnection between faith identity and other identities. It’s about being  a cohesive comunity, working together and respecting each other. Today we can see that this has happened; we have has over 80 people donating their time, skills and energy  to Rainbow Jews.  And, I'd say  - in line with  Eurovision drag star Conchita : 'we are unstoppable!” (Surat Knan, RJ founder) 

What Else Can I Do?  

Even if you can't donate, or can only contribute a little, there's still a lot you can do:

  • Help get the Rainbow Jews appeal noticed! Share this campaign everywhere you can!
  • Use the built-in Indiegogo share tools to spread this on your social networks.
  • Become a long-term supporter! The charity Liberal Judaism is able to take donations directly. Speak to us about possibilities. 


Thank you for your support.

Surat, Rainbow Jews founder and manager, and the dedicated RJ volunteer team x


A  final message from Surat, Rainbow Jews founder :'Please donate right now, so we can make sure that our history will not become our past.'

Photo above courtesy of Grant Denkinson
