story:
LEVÁNTATE! : COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS FESTIVAL 

The New Haven Free Skool is an all-volunteer team that believes that with education and art we can move towards a more inclusive, hopeful, active community. 

After offering nearly 80 free classes to hundreds of folks from across the Greater New Haven Area, we are working in the Fair Haven neighborhood to create community connections!

LEVÁNTATE! is a community connections festival. Ten local businesses have donated food, coffee, utensils, and more, and we've talked to hundreds of people door-to-door or in local organizations asking them to come out to this event! There's a ton of buzz in the neighborhood and everyone is excited for another opportunity to come together!

.

CAN YOU THROW US A 20?

We need to raise $545 to cover three costs:

1) A permit and staff person for the Atwater Senior Center from the Department of Parks, Recreation, and Trees.

2) A food permit from the Health Department. 

3) Art supplies and materials.

Without you, this event won't be possible! Take those $5 or $10 or $50 bucks you were going to spend today and help support LEVÁNTATE, help us build community connections! 


LET'S MAKE IT HAPPEN

Support our vision. Come to our event. Join our team. Teach a class. Take a class. Spread the word. Come to our Event. E-mail us at newhavenfreeskool@gmail.com. Print out some flyers. Tell your friends. Tell your co-workers. Tell your family. Did we mention, come to 

LEVÁNTATE: COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS FESTIVAL

Sunday, April 6, 1-4pm 

Atwater Senior Center
story_txt: LEVÁNTATE! : COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS FESTIVAL The New Haven Free Skool is an all-volunteer team that believes that with education and art we can move towards a more inclusive, hopeful, active community. After offering nearly 80 free classes to hundreds of folks from across the Greater New Haven Area, we are working in the Fair Haven neighborhood to create community connections!LEVÁNTATE! is a community connections festival. Ten local businesses have donated food, coffee, utensils, and more, and we've talked to hundreds of people door-to-door or in local organizations asking them to come out to this event! There's a ton of buzz in the neighborhood and everyone is excited for another opportunity to come together!.CAN YOU THROW US A 20?We need to raise $545 to cover three costs:1) A permit and staff person for the Atwater Senior Center from the Department of Parks, Recreation, and Trees.2) A food permit from the Health Department. 3) Art supplies and materials.Without you, this event won't be possible! Take those $5 or $10 or $50 bucks you were going to spend today and help support LEVÁNTATE, help us build community connections! LET'S MAKE IT HAPPENSupport our vision. Come to our event. Join our team. Teach a class. Take a class. Spread the word. Come to our Event. E-mail us at newhavenfreeskool@gmail.com. Print out some flyers. Tell your friends. Tell your co-workers. Tell your family. Did we mention, come to LEVÁNTATE: COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS FESTIVALSunday, April 6, 1-4pm Atwater Senior Center

story:
About Me

Hi! My name is Rhianna Reinmuth, and I am a 20 year-old junior Writing, Literature, & Publishing major at Emerson College in Boston, Massachusetts. I want to dedicate my life to making a difference. 

What is the Institute for Compassionate Leadership?

The Institute for Compassionate Leadership empowers the next generation of socially conscious, self-aware and compassionate leaders by educating classes of Millennial-generation aspiring change-makers in a wide variety of disciplines including meditation, community organizing, and traditional leadership skills, ultimately finding students meaningful employment upon program completion. In the six months with the Institute students receive:

  • Executive coaching
  • Mentorship from experienced change-makers
  • Our in-depth authenticity training program
  • Placement in meaningful social change work

Institute for Compassionate Leadership training fully equips tomorrow’s leaders as they meet worldwide challenges and strive to shape a better and brighter future for our world.

What This Means to Me

What it all boils down to is that I want to help people, and I want to help them in a big way, but I don't know where to get started. I first heard about the Institute for Compassionate Leadership after I read the founder, Lodro Rinzler's first book and he introduced me to the Shambhala tradition. I believe that every person has fundamental goodness, and I recognize this goodness in every person I come into contact with. It is my life's goal to maximize my own basic goodness to the fullest degree and utilize it to the best of my ability. 

This program will give me the leadership skills I need to make positive social change in our society. It will also help me to figure out which cause I want to focus my energy on to make that change. Upon completion of the program, I plan on using the skills I've acquired to start a non-profit organization, and the Institute will help me to accomplish this.

How You Can Help

I am honored to have been accepted into the inaugural class of the ICL. However, the program costs $7500 total, and as a full-time college student, I need all the help I can get.

story:
Sophie Finds a Friend- a book for children on the autism spectrum.

We are so excited to introduce to you the opportunity to support the Sophie Finds a Friend book project!  Many people have already stepped up to support the effort to get this book published! We are getting closer and closer everyday, and with a little more help, we will be able to deliver this wonderful resource to teacher, parents and service dog organizations!

With the rising diagnosis for children on the autism spectrum, this book was created to introduce young children to the emotions of happy and sad and the corresponding emotion in dogs. Please show your support by making a contribution (no contribution is too small- or too big!) to this extremely worthwhile project.

The Book!

The book is starring “Sophie" a small, round, fat, yellow Labrador puppy as she goes through an adventure where she discovers and reacts with her emotions and empathy. As autistic children often have difficulty understanding and showing emotions, Sophie non-verbally shares her emotions with a shy boy. The book helps promote learning and understanding of the dog and their sharing of the connection to emotions and empathy. By showing emotion and empathy from a dog’s point of view, it encourages children and adults connect with their humaneness and empathy for other people and animals.

Also included in the book are "Tips and Resources for Parents and Teachers" that shows parents, teachers and therapists how to use the book and some additional resources on dogs, service dog organizations, and the relationship between children and nature (dogs). All illustrations were hand painted in watercolor by the author.

Recent research indicates that early intervention can help children with communication issues and increase adaptation to their environment. Stanford University is currently researching early intervention therapies for children at the infant/toddler range. This is a perfect book for dog lovers as well! It can be used for any child between the ages of 18 months to 4 years. They will love Sophie!



My purpose!

My purpose of the book is twofold. One, to create a book using sweet, lovable puppy discovering and learning things children need to learn- emotions and empathy. Young children are introduced to the non-verbal communication of the dog as well as reinforcing the concepts of happy and sad. Perhaps one day a child on the autism spectrum will have a "Sophie" of their own to help bridge social and developmental challenges.

The second purpose is to introduce elements of Humane Education to teach parents and educators about the emotions of dogs and the relationship between humans and nature. The insightful books Minding Animals by Marc Bekoff and the Biophilia Hypothesis by Wilson/Kellert, inspired me to create a project where I could bring nature (the relationship of humans and dogs) to children that struggle with learning emotional connections. Biophilia literally means “love of life or living systems”. Additionally, the book Children and Nature by Kahn and Kellert, describes the particularly close relationship of children with nature, especially animals.  The connection between humans and nature (dogs) may impact the very nature of our well-being. 

Some of the research!

Professional and educational studies explore canine early learning, fearfulness, socialization, personality testing and emotion in dogs and puppies. Research has been done on the processes of providing service dogs for people with Autism. This research includes information on the success rate, the welfare of the dogs, their personality testing and how dogs are placed.

Studies show early education and relationship-based therapy for young children on the Autism spectrum has success with developmental awareness and cognition. Dogs are being introduced into these therapies in more and more ways. Dogs are also being used in homes and clinics to help create a calm environment, bridge social gaps and have been shown to increase empathetic awareness in children with ASD.  I strongly feel that through the processes of humane education backed by the Biophilia Hypothesis, we can reach out and help these children connect with these special dogs at critical stages of early learning.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm raising funds to self publish the book though Lulu.com!! This company will guide me through the entire process of publishing the book. Over the last year I have created the story and illustrations and I am ready to publish! Lulu.com will provide copy-editing, cover design and production, publicity and marketing tools. The best part is that they will also grant the book an ISBN number, and place it on the Amazon marketplace for sale around the world! Lulu is a POD (Print on Demand) resource, so my book will always be available and never out of stock! People will be able to order any quantity they need and have it shipped directly to them!

Once the book is published, we will partner with nonprofit service dog organizations specializing in Autism service dogs, include Autism parent-support sites and therapists to help spread the word about this important work and get this book to the children and parents that need it.

  • My goal is to raise $5,000. About $1500- 2000 will go towards the Lulu.com set up, ISBN number, marketing and placement on Amazon.com and other worldwide distributions. 
  • $1000 will be raised to publish and send the books out with my perks. (See my PERKS!)
  • The remainder of any funds will be used to print additional books to send out to non-profit organizations (service dogs and autism/parent resource groups) libraries and therapist offices.
  • If we fall short of our goal, every penny will be used to reach as many people as we can. And YOU can participate and help me accomplish this worthwhile effort by just donating any amount or by purchasing a copy of the book in my PERKS page! The book is charming, delightful and suitable for a child of any age. Get several for your children, nieces, nephews, and grandchildren! The book would also make a wonderful baby shower gift! By participating in this fundraiser, you will be supporting children with autism and their parents by helping the children connect to their emotions, their dogs and to each other!
  • If we are able to go over target, we intend to manufacture a small Sophie stuffed animal to go along with the book, so the children will have a dog to pet! We are also planning a follow up book to help children with other challenges faced by children on the autism spectrum such as safety and preventing flare ups or melt-downs.

  • Other Ways You Can Help
  • Even if you feel you can't contribute right now, You can you can STILL HELP! Send this to any and all of your friends and neighbors and co-workers who have/know families that have children on the spectrum, or are looking to get an autism service dog in the future. Support this important project and make some noise about this valuable work!
  • Even a dollar will help, really. But more helps more! 
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Please help get this book funded! Sophie says,  "Yes!!" “Woof!”

story:
My name is Andrew Gray and I have been working with the for-purpose organization, Pencils of Promise for over 5 years now. After hearing that I started the first collegiate chapter for them, gave a TEDx talk on their organization, spoke about their cause at the United Nations, rallied support from my local community, raised $8000+ for them, and committed to building a school before I graduate college, you would probably think I have met them before, right? WRONG!

Now, I have the opportunity to meet the people that have not only inspired me greatly, taught me so much about myself, motivated me to make a difference and to care about the world, but that have also been some of my best friends that I have never even had the opportunity to meet face-to-face! Not only will I meet these people and see the PoP offices, but I am also helping to publicize a book by the founder, Adam Braun. There will be a book release party for his book on March 18th in NYC that I would be able to attend and not only get the chance to meet a man that has inspired me beyond belief, but I would also get a chance to help hands-on with something that I have poured so much time into!

I have already scheduled a flight to NYC and back, but it was about $800, and a little out of my price range. On top of that, I have no spending money for transportation, food, etc. I am hoping to raise $1000 by FRIDAY of this week in order to participate in this trip and have some transportation/food money. Every dollar counts, even a $5 donation will go a long way!

 I know it is not my birthday yet, but in lieu of gifts for my birthday, I would ask for donations to this campaign to meet the people that have meant so much to me over the past five years, and to help Adam with the release of his book. I absolutely welcome any questions you may have and would absolutely LOVE your support, I PROMISE I will make the most of it! Thank you SO much for your support, I cannot put into words how much this opportunity means to me!

Best,

Andrew Gray

andrew.gray63@gmail.com

story:
Help us envision and create a new SOUTH 

Help fund 30 Immigrant leaders in Alabama get to this years SEIRN(South East Immigrant Rights network) 2015 Conference in Hampton, Georgia. This conference will take place August 28-30.

  • The Alabama Coalition for Immigrant Justice (ACIJ) has been on the front lines of immigrant rights organizing in Alabama since 2006. ACIJ successfully fought back against the harshest anti-immigrant state-law in the whole country HB-56 (inspired by Arizona's SB-1070) and stopped these anti-immigrant laws from spreading to other states.  ACIJ has created a vehicle to uplift our immigrant communities out of the shadows and into civic participation, cultivating leadership development and the dismantling of our own oppression.
  • The south is famous for having a legacy of extreme racial discrimination with high racial tension, and low recourses. SEIRN has helped us come together as southern states and become one voice, more powerfully able to destroy cultural, racial and language barriers facing our immigrant communities. Through a culture of popular education our leaders will learn from the best the south has to offer in civic engagement, campaign management, strategic outreach and much more!  Alabama will bring to the rest of the Southeast some of the best we have to offer in story telling, cultural organizing, strategic use of media, and much more! 
  • With your donations you will not only help ACIJ build a stronger Alabama but you will also help build a unified immigrant rights movement across the south.  Before joining our ACIJ family some of our immigrant leaders felt alone, felt like it was just them against the battalions of racism and the U.S. immigration system. Now, they have found a family here in Alabama that has got their backs and gives them extra strength to show publicly and proudly who they are.  With your help, they will find an even bigger family across the south that will fortify their ability to stand up for their families and communities! 

Please check out ACIJ in action by visiting our Website, Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

What We Need & What You Get!

This is where your money goes!! 

  • 3 Vans for 3 days = $1,550
  • 30 people X $105 per person registration and housing for two night = $3,150
  • 1 rental car going early to help with Conference preparation = $250
We have some awesome perks for all of you great donors: 
  1. Donations of $20 will get a thankful twitter shout out! 
  2. Donations of $40 will receive an ACIJ red and white wristband! 
  3. Donations of $60 will receive an ACIJ red T-Shirt!
In any situation where we do not meet our goal funds will still be used to secure travel for ACIJ members traveling to the SEIRN conference.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate, then you can always use your network to spread the word about our campaign and our organization!
  • You need to stay connected! visit our website and sing up to receive our news letter. 
  • Like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter and Instagram! please don't forget to use the share button and tweet @ALimmigrant

story:
The lack of diversity in this year's Oscars got you upset? Don't hate - donate! 

Donate $15 to Reel Grrls and your gift will be put towards arts education for middle school students from Seattle's diverse Rainier Valley, training them in the art of media literacy and production through mobile technology.
Donations will go towards our new mobile strategy, specifically to buy a set of 15 ipod touches for our new after school program at Aki Kurose Middle School, starting March 4th. Aki Kurose students are 97% youth of color, and 75% qualify for free and reduce lunch.  Purchasing ipod touches, rather than expensive DSLR cameras allows all youth in the program to have access to a mobile camera, rather than sharing resources. After programs are over, the likelihood of youth having access to a camera phone is more likely than a DSLR. If you are upset of the lack of diversity at the 2015 Oscars, then donate today to invest in youth of color learning the skills to go behind and in front of the camera. 

Want to learn more about Reel Grrls' mobile strategy?

Reel Grrls' Mobile Strategy will continue to provide media literacy and technology training that is inclusive and empowering. Going mobile just means some small shifts in how we go about doing that:

  • It means meeting youth where they're at physically -- in latitude, longitude terms.
  • This makes us versatile and agile, and most importantly, allows us to reach communities we were not able to serve before. 
  • It means meeting youth where they're at in technology-- mobile phones & social channels.
  • Most youth (and particularly youth of color) are accessing the internet and participating in online community engagement through their mobile devices. 
  • Mobile devices are becoming more and more accessible, economically. AND their cameras are improving in quality by the second. (Folks are even using mobile phones to help create films worthy of oscar-nominations and to make amazing content! )
  • They have the power to create and distribute media on their devices constantly-- to respond to messaging they are receiving in ads and mainstream media, and... 
  • More importantly to SPARK trends of their own.
  • Mobile means mobile. 

The basics of the media literacy, critical thinking skills, and storytelling we teach apply no matter what the technology de jour happens to be. Our core is about strengthening youth to be critical thinkers, makers, storytellers, and to be lifelong learners-- to not be afraid of technology and pushing buttons. In other words, how can we empower youth to use the tools close at hand to share their ideas?

Reel Grrls is taking its programs to where the Grrls are because we realize we can’t limit ourselves to telling the stories of Grrls in Seattle only. Retaining the core of our approach to youth development and girl empowerment, we’re now shifting gears and going mobile with our programs. Going mobile means we will destroy geographic barriers to media empowerment for young women all over Washington, and better serve those in our city too. By taking it to the Grrls, we will help more Grrls of diverse ethnic and socioeconomic backgrounds tell their stories and take on the world.

We need you to help Reel Grrls expand access and take media education and empowerment straight to the youth we serve.

Give now and invest in a more diverse media future. 

Help us take our program to the Grrls so they can take on the status quo.

Donate $15 to Reel Grrls and your gift will be put towards arts education for middle school students from Seattle's diverse Rainier Valley, training them in the art of media literacy and production through mobile technology.

Donations will go towards our new mobile strategy, specifically to buy a set of 15 ipod touches for our new after school program at Aki Kurose Middle School, starting March 4th. Aki Kurose students are 97% youth of color, and 75% qualify for free and reduce lunch.  Purchasing ipod touches, rather than expensive DSLR cameras allows all youth in the program to have access to a mobile camera, rather than sharing resources. After programs are over, the likelihood of youth having access to a camera phone is more likely than a DSLR. If you are upset of the lack of diversity at the 2015 Oscars, then donate today to invest in youth of color learning the skills to go behind and in front of the camera. 

Want to learn more about Reel Grrls' mobile strategy?
Reel Grrls' Mobile Strategy will continue to provide media literacy and technology training that is inclusive and empowering. Going mobile just means some small shifts in how we go about doing that:

It means meeting youth where they're at physically -- in latitude, longitude terms.
This makes us versatile and agile, and most importantly, allows us to reach communities we were not able to serve before. 
It means meeting youth where they're at in technology-- mobile phones & social channels.
Most youth (and particularly youth of color) are accessing the internet and participating in online community engagement through their mobile devices. 
Mobile devices are becoming more and more accessible, economically. AND their cameras are improving in quality by the second. (Folks are even using mobile phones to help create films worthy of oscar-nominations and to make amazing content! )
They have the power to create and distribute media on their devices constantly-- to respond to messaging they are receiving in ads and mainstream media, and... 
More importantly to SPARK trends of their own.
Mobile means mobile. 

The basics of the media literacy, critical thinking skills, and storytelling we teach apply no matter what the technology de jour happens to be. Our core is about strengthening youth to be critical thinkers, makers, storytellers, and to be lifelong learners-- to not be afraid of technology and pushing buttons. In other words, how can we empower youth to use the tools close at hand to share their ideas?
Reel Grrls is taking its programs to where the Grrls are because we realize we can’t limit ourselves to telling the stories of Grrls in Seattle only. Retaining the core of our approach to youth development and girl empowerment, we’re now shifting gears and going mobile with our programs. Going mobile means we will destroy geographic barriers to media empowerment for young women all over Washington, and better serve those in our city too. By taking it to the Grrls, we will help more Grrls of diverse ethnic and socioeconomic backgrounds tell their stories and take on the world.
We need you to help Reel Grrls expand access and take media education and empowerment straight to the youth we serve.
Give now and invest in a more diverse media future. 
Help us take our program to the Grrls so they can take on the status quo.

story:
This summer, I will spend 5 weeks in a village in China teaching English to the local children.  The program I will be part of is called Learning Enterprises, and it is an organization that sends college students like myself to countries around the world to teach English to children.

I chose to volunteer with Learning Enterprises this summer because I love China and I love interacting with and teaching children.  This will be my fourth visit to China and each time has been an eye opening experience.  I hope that this visit will be too.  Last summer, I went to Shanghai and Chengdu in a study abroad program offered by my university, Georgetown.  We spent five weeks learning about China’s epidemiology and health care system at Fudan University and Sichuan University.  Although the topic of the trip was health-related, I was able to learn so much about China’s education system by interacting with the Chinese college students that we had class with.  I hope to be able to learn even more about China’s education system through Learning Enterprises, because education has always been a big part of my life.  As a high school student I worked at Kumon where I tutored children in English and Math.  At Georgetown, I work at a non-profit organization called Jumpstart, where I go to low-income preschools and teach young children how to read and write.  I believe that early education is important and I hope to carry on that ideal in China.

I am extremely excited about this volunteer opportunity, however, Learning Enterprises does not charge a fee to the participating students or to the communities that host us. Charging a hefty fee is not conducive to recruiting the best teachers or involving the communities who need it most.  LE covers its operational expenses from donations to its volunteers and staff.

The $2,000 will be going to the organization as well as supplies that I would like to bring to the kids.  It would really mean a lot to me if you could help me out by donating any amount.  At the end of the five weeks, I will share my experiences in China with my donors.  I have the link below where you can donate and I have until May 31st to fund raise.  If you would like to donate in RMB please contact me so we can find a way for you to donate.  Thank you so much!


今年夏天 通过“学习型企业” 机构 我会去南通附近的村庄教当地儿童英语，为期五个星期 吃住在村民家里。“学习型企业” 组织像我这样来自世界各国的大学生做志愿者，去世界各地教儿童英语。

我选择参与是因为我热爱中国，喜欢教孩子。这将是我第四次访问中国，每次都学到很多东西。去年夏天，我参加我的母校乔治城大学的留学项目赴上海和成都，我们在五周时间里，在复旦大学和四川大学了解了中国的流行病学和卫生保健系统，虽然行程的主题是与健康有关的，但是尔闻目睹加上与中国大学生有很多交流，我也学到很多关于中国的教育体系的知识。今夏我希望能学到更多中国的教育体系方面的知识，因为教育一直是我生活的重要组成部分。上高中时，我曾兼职辅导小学生的英语和数学。现在乔治城大学，我兼职 Jumpstart （非营利性组织），去低收入幼儿园，教幼儿如何读和写。因为我相信早期教育是很重要的，我也希望这一理想能在中国的乡村实现。

这个志愿者的机会令我感到非常兴奋，但“学习型企业”不收取费用，只是鼓励我们志愿者捐献. 因收取高额费用，并不利于招收最优秀的教师及受惠的社区，通常都是最需要的社区.

2000美元筹款将用在捐献给 “学习型企业”以及我想带给孩子们的学习用品。如果您能帮我们筹到捐款，我致以诚挚的谢意，并会在五周结束时，和你们分享我的经历。您可以用右手边这个捐赠的链接（美金），截止到6月30号。如果是人民币或者其它货币，请私信我，谢谢.

story:
Friends and family,

Thank you for taking the time to read  this campaign.  I hope you are able to support it in any way you can!  If you know me personally, you know how passionate I am about working with children with communication disorders as a speech therapist here in Columbus.  You may also understand that I feel my calling is not only limited to my own community, but to making a positive global impact in any small way that I can.

That being said, this November I will head to Antigua, Guatemala for one week as a volunteer speech pathologist to provide speech therapy to young Guatemalans with repaired cleft lip and/or palate.  My goal with this campaign is to be able to provide speech therapy materials and Spanish language books for the children and teens at the camp, in addition to some teaching materials for newly-trained Guatemalan speech therapists.  

Keep reading to understand  these childrens' journey's....

Please take a look at the video of the babies and children during pre- and post-surgery of cleft lip and palate.  Their young lives started with quite a bit of trauma with feeding and suckling difficulties, struggling to maintain adequate nutrition and making attempts to babble.  Throughout their early years they received a number of medical evaluations and dramatic surgeries to repair their facial and oral anomalies.  Now, imagine them years later, after many would believe they had overcome their hardships, only for them to continue to be teased and made to feel inadequate because of persistent speech and articulation issues.  This is where Campamento Sonrisas makes its lasting positive impact.  The two-week camp organized by Tess Unlimited (a non-profit organization--  https://www.facebook.com/TESSUnlimited/?fref=ts... training and speech therapy to children, parents, new Guatemalan speech therapy graduates, and other local community and global volunteers.  Volunteer psychologists  from across the globe also contribute their time.

Below I've listed the items that will be purchased in order to supply the camp with materials and books:

Disposable gloves, tongue depressors, straws, small mirrors, oral & nasal listener (ONL), alcohol wipes, Spanish articulation assessment (from TPT--no norms), 2 stethoscopes, lysol wipe packs, simple therapy games, (possible See-Scope therapy tool for nasal emission), Spanish language books/magazines for 10-20 year olds

SO...again, I thank you in advance for supporting these children who otherwise would not have access to therapy.  I hope you can contribute to help me reach this goal! Be sure to check back in for my report  of the fundraising progress and the pictures from Guatemala!!!!!

:)

Tia

p.s.  If you still need some motivation check out these links! ;)  

http://www.friendshipcircle.org/blog/2013/05/28...

http://info.tinyeye.com/the-importance-of-therapy

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18642488

story:
Intervención Hermanas del Buen Pastor Hogar de nuestra Señora

-  Presentado por Miss Panamá Mundo 2014 Raiza Erlenbaugh para Belleza con Propósito


Estimados Colaboradores,

Bienvenidos a nuestra campaña para la recolecta de fondos para remodelar este hogar a largo plazo, buscamos ayudar a crear un mundo mejor. Tomando acción como agentes de cambio en nuestra sociedad, iniciando en nuestra comunidad. 

Impulsamos un experimento social que impactará  la vida de veinticinco niñas amparadas por el proyecto “Santa Eufrasia” en el orfanato Hermanas del  Buen Pastor Hogar de nuestra señora”, ubicado en  San Sebastián, Ciudad de Panamá,  dedicado a la protección  de casos de alto riesgo social de los cuales son víctimas estas niñas. Teniendo como meta crear mujeres con personalidad autónoma capaces de cumplir de manera hábil y efectiva sus destinos. El tiempo de duración  de esta está estimado en dos meses y medio (2 ½). 

Talleres para el desarrollo de proyeccion

El concurso internacional " Miss Mundo " cuenta con una categoría dedicada al trabajo social. Esta categoría está respalda por " Belleza con un propósito ", una organización benéfica que trabaja alrededor del mundo ayudando a aliviar diferentes tipos de crisis, siendo de vital importancia el compromiso de responsabilidad social. . Esta organización apoya a dos causas principales: 

  • Proporcionar alivio durante los desastres naturales 
  •  Influir en las comunidades a través del trabajo social con la niñez.


Final de curso de pasarela y Miss Buen Pastor

Esta fundación es representada por las distintas embajadoras de Miss Mundo enviadas para competir por los países participantes. Raiza Erlenbaugh se convirtio en La delegada de Panamá, siendo coronada el pasado abril como Miss Panamá Mundo 2014.

#selfietime

Raiza, lanza una propuesta que busca impulsar un efecto en la sociedad panameña, iniciando con una intervención de tres facetas a la casa de amparo “Hermanas del Buen Pastor Hogar de nuestra señora”.

Se llevará a cabo un plan estratégico que contendrá talleres, recuperación e intervención de diferentes áreas del Hogar Buen Pastor con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y de aprendizaje.

Clases de  ingles 


Mural elaborado por las niñas 

A continuación desglosamos específicamente los rubros en los que necesitamos tu apoyo para hacer este sueño una realidad.

Presupuesto de materiales para reacomodación de Comedor, Cocina, Aula de Clases y talleres didácticos.


ETAPA 1

Construcción

​Este es un proyecto de 200 mts2 que se llevara a cabo durante dos meses y medio (2 ½) de trabajo, en donde estaremos reacomodando la estructura interna del hogar. Las áreas a tratar son: cocina, comedor y salón de clases, se instalara un diseño amigable para niños con materiales no tóxicos en el proyecto y provisión de mobiliario práctico y gráfico.


Comedor Actual

Cielo Raso -

  • se removerá el cielo raso existente de tipo escayola
  • se colocarán láminas nuevas para evitar la contaminación y promover el buen clima del lugar
  • La instalación incluye el armado y refuerzo de la estructura del techo interior y las láminas.

Electricidad -

  • suministro e instalación de veinte cuatro (24) lámparas 2 x 4 con balastro electrónico
  • diez (10) ventiladores de techo industriales para salones
  • artefactos eléctricos nuevos acorde con el diseño como:

              -interruptores

             - toma corrientes.

              -cajas eléctricas

             - tuberías y cableado

Imagen de la cocina en su estado actual


Ebanistería/ Mobiliario -

  • suministro de 3 mesas para 12 comensales en el área del comedor
  • mesa para 8 comensales en el comedor de servicio para el personal del Hogar Buen Pastor
  • confección de muebles para guardar suministros de comida
  • mueble en el aula de clases  para guardar sus útiles
  • confección de mueble estantería para vegetales y frutas en el área de la cocina
  • suministros de cocina

            - utensilios para cocinar

             -estufa eléctrica

              -horno

              -nevera

             -microondas

             -licuadora

  • instalación de puertas y gavetas nuevas en la cocina

Pintura -

  • se pintaran las áreas: cocina, comedor y salón de clases, usando pinturas no toxicas para cuidar el medio ambiente y la salud de los usuarios.

Foto del salón de clases


Instalaciones de artes Gráficas 

El tema de la remodelación es un Jardin de fantasia y aprendizaje


Salón de clases:


Instalación de gráficos con juegos educativos como: rayuela educativa, serpiente de letras y huellas de las niñas. Mural sobre acrílico elaborado por artistas con mensajes educativos.

  • Mural "Aprender"  

  • Mesa "Teacher"l

  • Mural "Derechos de la Niña/Mujer"  

  • Stickers para "Circulo de Lectura" 

  • Stickers de "Palabras Positivismo" para Mesas del Salón

  • Letrero para Señalización de la Puerta 

  • Stickers "Guardar Zapatos / Mochilas" "Mantener el Orden"


Cocina:


Instalación de diseños salteados sobre azulejos de cocina, frases motivadoras en las paredes

  • Bancada Central Tema Gráfico:  

  • Stickers para Puertas de los Armarios 

  • Identificacion y Señalización / Organización

  • Letrero para Señalización de la Puerta

  • Sticker: "LAVE LOS ALIMENTOS"  

  • Revestimiento de (02) Paredes de Azulejo 

  • Stickers de Reciclaje para Tanques / Cocina / Residuos Orgánicos


Comedor:

Mural sobre acrílico elaborado con el resultado del taller 1, montaje de Frases motivadoras sobre en las paredes, manteles creados por las niñas en el taller 2

  • Mural "Árbol de la Vida"  

  • Bancada de Madera para sentar / Comedor 

  • Letrero para Señalización de la Puerta 

  • Sticker Oración Bendiciones 


Exterior:

Jardín de fantasía montado en paredes de fachada para unificar las áreas de cocina, comedor y salón de clases

  • Rótulos indicadores de salones sobre las puertas

  • Placa del proyecto con mención de colaboración de benefactores.

  • Rayuelas "Area Externa"

  • Mural "Jardin HOGAR"


Celebrando con nuestros amigos y colaboradores


Talleres-

Estas clases tendrán una duración de cuatro (4) sesiones, con el propósito de utilizar el arte como influencia en el desarrollo de valores y proceso cognitivo.

  Taller 1:

  • Clase de pintura para liberación artística y creativa.

          o  Este taller es una introducción al arte y cultura como herramienta de expresión saludable. El material creado será empleado como obra presente en el área de comedor  del hogar, mediante la enmarcación de cada  una de las piezas.

Taller 2:

  • Elaboración de cuadros personalizados.

           o  Este taller tendrá una duración de tres sesiones, está enfocado en aplicar las técnicas aprendidas de expresión individual en un lienzo conjunto para reforzar el trabajo en equipo y ampliar la comunicación de las niñas en el hogar. Como sorpresa el lienzo será plastificado para convertirse en manteles del área de comedor.

Material didáctico

  • manta sucia
  • hojas de papel de distintos tamaños
  • pilotos
  • lápices de colorear
  • acrílicos
  •  pinceles
  • plástico de forrar

Gracias al American Society por su ayuda

Comunicacion

  •  gira de medios en el país para exponer el proyecto
  •  redes sociales, activaciones ATL y BTL del proyecto
  • video documental del proyecto
  • alcance nacional: 2 millones de espectadores
  • alcance internacional: mas de 127 millones de televidentes
  •  promoción de responsabilidad social de colaboradores en placa de obra, video y menciones en medios



 


Muestra del show de talento, recitando el poema Chimbombo


¿Cómo ayudar?

Puedes hacer donaciones de las siguientes maneras:

  • Donación de  materiales de:construcción, alimentos, prendas de vestir, material educativo coordinado exclusivamente por 
  • intervnecionbuenpastor@gmail.com o gerencia@misspanama.com.pa
  • Referiré nuestra causa entre tus colegas y amigos dando like en nuestras redes sociales.
  • Donación efectiva en nuestra campana de este sitio.
  • voluntariado: culmina tus horas de servicio social universitario mientras cambias vidas.


Ayudanos a regalar una sonrisa a quien lo necesita. Agradecemos tu donación para mejorar la calidad de vida de estas niñas, que lo único que quieren es ser igual a ti. La satisfacción más grande se logra cuando se da desinteresadamente. Raiza Miss Panamá Mundo  agradece a todos los que colaboran en la “Intervención Hogar Buen Pastor” por el apoyo  meritorio. Gracias a su apoyo nos comprometemos a llevar a cabo esta y más intervenciones a lo largo y ancho de Panamá.

nuestra Señora

organización apoya a dos causas principales: 

Proporcionar alivio durante los
desastres naturales 


 Influir en las comunidades a través del trabajo social
con la niñez.

Final de curso de pasarela y Miss Buen PastorEsta fundación es representada por las distintas embajadoras de Miss
Mundo enviadas para competir por los países participantes. Raiza Erlenbaugh se convirtio en La delegada de Panamá, siendo coronada el pasado abril como Miss
Panamá Mundo 2014.#selfietimeRaiza, lanza una propuesta que busca impulsar un efecto en la sociedad panameña, iniciando con una intervención de tres facetas a la casa de amparo “Hermanas del Buen Pastor Hogar de nuestra señora”.Se llevará a cabo un plan estratégico que contendrá talleres, recuperación e intervención de diferentes áreas del Hogar Buen Pastor con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y de aprendizaje.Clases de  ingles Mural elaborado por las niñas 
A continuación desglosamos específicamente los rubros en los que necesitamos tu apoyo para hacer este sueño una realidad.


Presupuesto de materiales para reacomodación de Comedor,
Cocina, Aula de Clases y talleres didácticos.



ETAPA 1
Construcción
​Este es un proyecto de 200 mts2 que se llevara a cabo durante dos meses y medio (2 ½) de trabajo, en donde estaremos reacomodando la estructura interna del hogar. Las áreas a tratar son: cocina, comedor y salón de clases, se instalara un diseño amigable para niños con materiales no tóxicos en el proyecto y provisión de mobiliario práctico y gráfico.





Comedor Actual
Cielo Raso -



se removerá el cielo raso existente de tipo escayola


se colocarán láminas nuevas para evitar la contaminación y promover el buen clima del lugar


La instalación incluye el armado y refuerzo de la estructura del techo interior y las láminas.


Electricidad -



suministro e instalación de veinte cuatro (24) lámparas 2 x 4 con balastro electrónico


diez (10) ventiladores de techo industriales para salones


artefactos eléctricos nuevos acorde con el diseño como:


              -interruptores
             - toma corrientes.
              -cajas eléctricas
             - tuberías y cableado


Imagen de la cocina en su estado actual


Ebanistería/ Mobiliario -



suministro de 3 mesas para 12 comensales en el área del comedor


mesa para 8 comensales en el comedor de servicio para el personal del Hogar Buen Pastor


confección de muebles para guardar suministros de comida


mueble en el aula de clases  para guardar sus útiles


confección de mueble estantería para vegetales y frutas en el área de la cocina


suministros de cocina


            - utensilios para cocinar
             -estufa eléctrica
              -horno
              -nevera
             -microondas
             -licuadora


instalación de puertas y gavetas nuevas en la cocina


Pintura -


se pintaran las áreas: cocina, comedor y salón de clases, usando pinturas no toxicas para cuidar el medio ambiente y la salud de los usuarios.



Foto del salón de clases
Instalaciones de artes Gráficas 



El tema de la remodelación es un Jardin de fantasia y aprendizaje

Salón de clases:



Instalación de gráficos con juegos educativos como: rayuela educativa, serpiente de letras y huellas de las niñas. Mural sobre acrílico elaborado por artistas con mensajes educativos.

Mural "Aprender"  
Mesa "Teacher"l

Mural "Derechos de la Niña/Mujer"  
Stickers para "Circulo de Lectura" 
Stickers de "Palabras Positivismo" para Mesas del Salón
Letrero para Señalización de la Puerta 
Stickers "Guardar Zapatos / Mochilas" "Mantener el Orden"





Cocina:


Instalación de diseños salteados sobre azulejos de cocina, frases motivadoras en las paredes

Bancada Central Tema Gráfico:  
Stickers para Puertas de los Armarios 
Identificacion y Señalización / Organización
Letrero para Señalización de la Puerta
Sticker: "LAVE LOS ALIMENTOS"  
Revestimiento de (02) Paredes de Azulejo 
Stickers de Reciclaje para Tanques / Cocina / Residuos Orgánicos



Comedor:


Mural sobre acrílico elaborado con el resultado del taller 1, montaje de Frases motivadoras sobre en las paredes, manteles creados por las niñas en el taller 2

Mural "Árbol de la Vida"  
Bancada de Madera para sentar / Comedor 
Letrero para Señalización de la Puerta 
Sticker Oración Bendiciones 



Exterior:

Jardín de fantasía montado en paredes de fachada para unificar las áreas de cocina, comedor y salón de clases


Rótulos indicadores de salones sobre las puertas

Placa del proyecto con mención de colaboración de benefactores.
Rayuelas "Area Externa"
Mural "Jardin HOGAR"





Celebrando con nuestros amigos y colaboradores
Talleres-


Estas clases tendrán una duración de
cuatro (4) sesiones, con el propósito de utilizar el arte como influencia en el
desarrollo de valores y proceso cognitivo.
  Taller 1: 


Clase de pintura para liberación artística
y creativa.

          o  Este
taller es una introducción al arte y cultura como herramienta de expresión
saludable. El material creado será empleado como obra presente en el área de
comedor  del hogar, mediante la
enmarcación de cada  una de las piezas.



Taller 2: 


Elaboración de cuadros personalizados.

           o  Este
taller tendrá una duración de tres sesiones, está enfocado en aplicar las
técnicas aprendidas de expresión individual en un lienzo conjunto para reforzar
el trabajo en equipo y ampliar la comunicación de las niñas en el hogar. Como
sorpresa el lienzo será plastificado para convertirse en manteles del área de
comedor.
Material didáctico 



manta sucia

hojas de papel de distintos tamaños
pilotos

lápices de colorear


acrílicos


 pinceles


plástico de forrar





Gracias al American Society por su ayuda

Comunicacion


 gira de medios en el país para exponer el
proyecto


 redes sociales, activaciones ATL y BTL del
proyecto


video documental del proyecto


alcance nacional: 2 millones de
espectadores


alcance internacional: mas de 127 millones
de televidentes


 promoción de responsabilidad social de
colaboradores en placa de obra, video y menciones en medios





 
Muestra del show de talento, recitando el poema Chimbombo

¿Cómo ayudar?
Puedes hacer donaciones de las siguientes maneras:



Donación de  materiales de:construcción, alimentos, prendas de vestir, material educativo coordinado exclusivamente por 


intervnecionbuenpastor@gmail.com o gerencia@misspanama.com.pa


Referiré nuestra causa entre tus colegas y amigos dando like en nuestras redes sociales.


Donación efectiva en nuestra campana de este sitio.


voluntariado: culmina tus horas de servicio social universitario mientras cambias vidas.


Ayudanos a regalar una sonrisa a quien lo necesita. Agradecemos tu donación para mejorar la calidad de vida de estas niñas, que lo único que quieren es ser igual a ti. La satisfacción más grande se logra cuando se da desinteresadamente. Raiza Miss Panamá Mundo  agradece a todos los que colaboran en la “Intervención Hogar Buen Pastor” por el apoyo  meritorio. Gracias a su apoyo nos comprometemos a llevar a cabo esta y más intervenciones a lo largo y ancho de Panamá.

story: • Hello all! My name is Jacqueline Michael Whatley. I am a California State University Los Angeles alumna (Department of Anthropology), music critic with  LA WEEKLY and contributor to Kevin Powell's BKNation.org. I am interested in a year-long teaching experience in a foreign country. In order to make this dream a reality, a TEFL(Teaching English as a Foreign Language) certificate is necessary. The program that I wish to undertake, through Oxford Seminars, is $1195. This includes the enrollment deposit ($95) and the cost of the certification course ($1100). The course includes ESL Teaching Resources, full access to the English Language Schools Directory, and access to  graduate placement services that will assist me in promptly landing a teaching job abroad once certified. The certification course will be held at my alma mater CSULA from September 13th-28th, Saturdays and Sundays from 9:00am - 6:00pm. Gaining real life teaching experience is essential to my long-term goal of teaching at the university and community college levels. Gaining teaching experience in a foreign country will also afford me invaluable life experience. Your support, in any amount, helps immensely. Thank you!

story:
Not your average musical group. Not your average grannies. 
The Raging Grannies are more "Pussy Riot" than "Grandma", using songs as a vehicle to rage about injustice wherever they see it. 

Who are the Calgary Raging Grannies? 

The Calgary Raging Grannies are the local chapter ("gaggle") of the now infamous international activists out in the streets promoting social justice through song and humour.

The movement began in Victoria, BC in 1987 spreading across North America and includes chapters across the ocean in Australia, England, Israel and Scotland. 

Every 2 years a Gaggle hosts the Un-Convention to share stories, songs and ideas for activism. This year it is in Montreal June 25th - 28th, 2014 and will debut the NEW Canadian documentary "Granny Power"!

The Campaign

We are raising $5,000 to pay for the air fare and accommodation of 5 of the Calgary gaggle. Most of the grannies are retired, so attending the un-convention is a large expense to attend, but a valuable opportunity to learn and be inspired to continue to be a voice for change in Alberta singing for justice. 

By donating you are supporting a unique movement of older and wiser women who are willing to yell & sing for change. These activists have the foresight and wisdom to lead the way for younger generations. Granny knows best!

Donors can get an Original Raging Granny made bookmark and/or a Digital 2013 Songbook! Small donations are very welcome! 

Promote!

Watch our new videos above showcasing our recent musical Rants and Rages and share with your friends!

story:
What Is This All About?

Free IT Athens is an all-volunteer nonprofit organization that is inviting Richard Stallman, founder of the free software movement, GNU Project, the GNU General Public License and the Free Software Foundation to speak to the Athens, GA community on the topic of surveillance and privacy.  His lecture is entitled Should We Have More Surveillance than the USSR? Stallman is scheduled to speak on October 14th, 2014 at 8pm at the UGA Chapel.

What Am I Contributing To?

We cannot cover all of the expenses for this event up front, and would like to offer the event to the Athens, GA community free (gratis); and this is where your donation comes in! Your contribution (large or small) will cover:

  • Travel expenses
  • Booking fees
  • An honorarium
Your contribution will help us make this event happen.  Pitch in to have a chance to hear a lecture from one of the most important and controversial intellectuals of our time.

story:
EN KORT BESKRIVELSE

Jeg og Craig har da blitt valgt til å delta i et veldedighet prosjekt i Ghana, Afrika, som er arrangert av Lightyear Foundation Storbritannia!! Wohooo, vi er kjempe stolte og SÅ privilegerte for å ha blitt håndplukket til å bidra i et slikt eksepsjonelt prosjekt som dette, MEN mest av alt så er gleder vi oss noe utrolig!=)

MEN, vi trenger DIN hjelp. Vi må samle inn nok penger til å dekke reise utgifter, vaksinasjoner, Visum, utstyr til prosjektene men også utstyr til skolene i Ghana.  Lightyear Foundation er en liten organisasjon som kan kun gjøre sitt arbeid gjennom sonsorship og vennlige folk/venner/familie som vil donere penger til dette prosjektet. 

Prosjektet varer altså 2 uker og vi skal hovedsakelig holde undervisnings timer/presentasjoner  innenfor forskjellige miljøvennlige måter å lage energi (vi skal hjelpe lærere i å lage sol paneler) og rense vann (rensing av vann er et stort (og dyrt) problem i Afrika, men kan bli løst på en enkel måte individuelt), men vi skal også engasjere elever i å lære naturvitenskap på nye måter. YEY!

Det er da første gang Craig og jeg skal arbeide sammen og vi gleder oss kjempe masse!!=) Vi håper også at dette kan lede til andre muligheter til å jobbe med veldedighets organisasjoner verden over i årene framover. Vi har alltid hatt store ambisjoner i å gjøre verden mer miljøvennlig og vi tror dette prosjektet er en begynnelse på noe stort.

 

HVA VI TRENGER OG HVA DU VIL FÅ UT AV DET

Målet vårt er å få samlet opp £500 som da er ca 5000kr før den 7. Juni, 2013. 

Pengene dere donerer kommer til å bidra til:

-  Utstyr til de forskjellige presentasjonene/undervisnings timer (dette er da utstyr til 10 forskjellige skoler)

-  Utstyr til skolene som skal vare ut året (slik at de kan bruke det ut året, eller til neste gang vi kommer).

- Reise utgifter, visum og vaksinasjoner.  

 

Vi har også et donering system som vil gi deg gaver fra Ghana ELLER FOTO ALBUM/FILM fra turen=)YEY!  

-  Om du donerer £25 (som er ca. 250kr) vil du få et bilde fra prosjektet med en hilsen + utvalgte Ghana gaver av Craig og meg.

-  Om du donerer £50 (som er ca. 500kr) vil du få en foto album fra turen som er laget kun for deg + gaver fra Ghana!!

- Om du donerer £100 (som er ca. 1000kr) vil du få en video fra turen er laget kun for deg/dere + gaver fra Ghana!!

 

Dette er et supert prosjekt som kommer til å bli kjempe spennende for både oss og dere. YEY!

Tusen takk,

Stor klem,

Marthe og Craig Xx

story:
Summary

As a passionate social worker who enjoys helping people, particularly children I am currently in India performing community service for underprivilged children in Chandigarh and a village in rural Punjab. I predominantly came to Chandigarh to set up the Khelshala Computer Learning Center to add to its academic program and to teach children squash.

In speaking with Coach Bajwa, the Founder of Khelshala we felt a Mobile Computer Center for underprivileged youth both in Chandigarh and rural Punjab would enable further connectivity and productivity of the computer equipment so kindly donated by the State Bank of India. 

What is Khelshala?

Khelshala is an after school program that offers a fun environment through sport and provides academic tutoring, sport craft skills and wellbeing for underpriviiged children. For more information visit www.khelshala.in

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $15,000 to pay for a vehicle (a second hand bus or truck) that will be refurbished with computers and an internet connection.

You will receive several perks outlined to the right as well as updates from Coach Bajwa himself and his Khelshala volunteers. 

The Impact

Your contribution will enable the Khelshala Mobile Computing Center to teach underprivileged children both in the city of Chandigarh and rural Punjab, critical computer skills for employment and livelihoods in India. Furthermore the Mobile Computing Center will allow Khelshala teachers and students to be transported between its sites in Chandigarh and rural Punjab thereby contributing to the lives of youth in underserved areas. In short, it will provide the children a safe, secure environment keeping them engaged and off the streets.

My expertise in social work stems from professional experiences at the Aga Khan Foundation USA, Center for International Development at Harvard University, United Nations Volunteers and Reebok's Human Rights Programs. For a complete bio visit www.tariqmohammed.wordpress.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to make a financial contribution, you can still help us by spreading the word and connecting us with potential IT companies that willingly support nonprofit projects like the initiative of Khelshala to add a Mobile Computing Center to its activities.

story:
Short Summary

 

I am Devanik Saha, a Teach For India Fellow (2011-13). I was selected as one of the Top 25 Educational Innovators in 2012-13 Delhi by STIR Education ( a UK based NGO) for my low cost math model. Post my fellowship, I am co-starting a learning centre for empowering underprivileged girls in Sangam Vihar, an urban slum located in the heart of New Delhi, India which is the community where I currently teach.

The idea is to establish a learning hub focused towards educating girls to become community leaders and torchbearers of change for facilitating development and upliftment of their communities. With a strong focus on teaching social science and science to primary-level girls, belonging to both English and vernacular medium, the hubs will endeavour to use activity and project based learning as teaching tools to support their growth into responsible community leaders implementing community empowerment projects. English language skills would be imparted to high school girls using phonics program after which the girls would be involved with and trained to teach in our centers as we expand. Community impact projects will be pursued with women from the community engaging them in health awareness workshops. Weekends would be utilized in organizing Dance, Crafts, Arts and Self Defence classes for give to give effect to our objective of providing wholesome education. We would be involved with two major initiatives:

1) Primary Education Program

2) English Language Skills Program 

Our Team:

Devanik Saha ( Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer)

Swati Rao ( Co- Founder and Chief Operations Officer)

What We Need 

100 low cost math kits for kids: 200USD (2 USD/kit)

Basic Infrastructure and Logistics (like Fans, Sitting Mats, Lightbulbs, Wall Paint, Blackboards, Shelves, etc): 50USD

Books,Booklets and Materials: 100USD

Technology Based Learning (1 inexpensive tablet as teaching-aid): 100USD

Infrasturcture (Space Rent + Electricity Charge for 6 months): 480USD (80 USD/month) 

Total Funds required to run Pilot for 6 months: 930 USD

The Impact

Innumerable hurdles exist for students enrolled in government-run schools looking for a meaningful education. In these schools, there is an acute dearth of teachers and, unfortunately, even those few who have the privilege of having a teacher present are not taught properly. As a result, these promising girls are denied opportunities to receive wholesome education, severely denting their chances to improve their lives. Our centre aspires to give these girls a meaningful, wholesome and well-rounded education to tap their inner potential and use it to effect change in their communities. We aim to reach out to more than 500 girls in our first phase.

For my previous experience, you can have a detailed look at the team's experiences and achievements here.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us get the word out in your circles and networks.

We thank you for all your support! Any and every contribution takes us one step closer towards ensuring meaningful education for girls of Sangam Vihar, New Delhi.

Swati Rao ( Co- Founder and Chief Operations Officer)
What We Need 
100 low cost math kits for kids: 200USD (2 USD/kit) Basic Infrastructure and Logistics (like Fans, Sitting Mats, Lightbulbs, Wall Paint, Blackboards, Shelves, etc): 50USD Books,Booklets and Materials: 100USD Technology Based Learning (1 inexpensive tablet as teaching-aid): 100USDInfrasturcture (Space Rent + Electricity Charge for 6 months): 480USD (80 USD/month) 
Total Funds required to run Pilot for 6 months: 930 USD

The Impact
Innumerable hurdles exist for students enrolled in government-run schools looking for a meaningful education. In these schools, there is an acute dearth of teachers and, unfortunately, even those few who have the privilege of having a teacher present are not taught properly. As a result, these promising girls are denied opportunities to receive wholesome education, severely denting their chances to improve their lives. Our centre aspires to give these girls a meaningful, wholesome and well-rounded education to tap their inner potential and use it to effect change in their communities. We aim to reach out to more than 500 girls in our first phase.
For my previous experience, you can have a detailed look at the team's experiences and achievements here.
Other Ways You Can Help
You can help us get the word out in your circles and networks.
We thank you for all your support! Any and every contribution takes us one step closer towards ensuring meaningful education for girls of Sangam Vihar, New Delhi.

story:
CHILDREN OF THE SUN HUMANITARIAN FOUNDATION

SEEKS FUNDING

FOR THE GLOBAL PEACE OPERATIONS


Launching this August, 2013

You may be aware of the massive demonstrations, protests, human tragedies and revolutions currently happening in the Middle East. The energy of hatred is spreading like a virus and peace-loving people are being persecuted in their own countries.      

As we become aware of these human atrocities that affect us so deeply in our hearts, we often ask ourselves,

How can we help, especially for those of us who are so far away?

How can we unify on mass scale to create planetary peace?

 



THE GLOBAL PEACE OPERATIONS

BE PART OF A SOLUTION


What is the Global Peace Operations?

1. Creating a network of Peace Emissaries in active and focused planetary service
2. Coordinated and timely peace transmissions to areas of conflict
3. Peace delegations traveling to these regions to have a physical presence
4. Software app development for instant notifications of the peace transmissions
5. Building program awareness through social marketing


The Global Peace Operations is a self-organizing plan to build a network of 144,000 passionate people committed to peace who can all be interlinked, in an instant, through mobile technology.

We are placing ourselves in service to be used as one group instrument through which the streams of love can be transferred into trauma-zones, creating a grid of peace while transforming the imprints of separation.

It is from our ONE unified consciousness, in full focused action, that is our greatest influencing power to create lasting change.

We are calling forth all Ambassadors of Peace to team up with us and... AWAKEN PROFOUND PEACE! 





MEDITATION JOINS WITH TECHNOLOGY TO BRING PEACE


YOUR APP FOR PEACE!

We are developing a Global Peace Operations App, allowing all of us to simultaneously receive notifications for: Awakening Profound Peace. (APP)

You know instantly when a Peace Meditation is about to take place, a time when all of us can spontaneously drop in at the same powerful moment, to beam our love and light to the intense pockets of energy on our planet.  

YOUR MEDIA FEEDS FOR PEACE!

To support the Awakening Profound Peace alerts... videos, photos and media feed updates will be offered to reveal the demonstrations of love that you are participating in, the impact you are making and the miraculous story that is unfolding in front of our eyes.
 


AWAKEN PROFOUND PEACE and link up with us now!

 


SCIENTIFIC PROOF ASSURES OUR COLLECTIVE QUEST

Since the inception of Children of the Sun Foundation in 2007, its platform of global volunteers has been proving, through direct experience, what scientists have been testing in laboratory and extensive field studies for decades.  

          


A plethora of quantifiable scientific research consistenly offers the sound evidence that group prayers and meditations of geographically separated individuals can promote peace, health and beneficial behavior for others also located over great distances.  


See Our Results: Scientific Backing for Children of the Sun Foundation

Read Further Evidence: PermanentPeace.org, Institute of Heart Math Research

 

  We actually have a technology of peace. We can manfiest peace in the world. It is just a matter of support to bring groups together sufficiently large to co-create this influence.  
Craig Pearson PhD, Vice President, Maharishi University of Management, USA

  There is far more evidence that group meditation can turn off war like a light switch, than there is evidence that aspirin reduces headache; it’s a scientific fact!
John Hagelin Ph.D, Harvard University, Director of the Institute of Science, Technology and Public Policy, USA.




Our 1st Assignment Completes!  

ANCHORING A GRID OF PEACE IN SYRIA AND EGYPT

See Update Videos in our Campaign Gallery

The Synchronized Peace Transmissions for Syria and Egypt have just been completed and we are are happy to report a huge success!

          

 
Thousands of participants from around the world connected in synchronous rhythm, responding to the heightening tensions in the Middle East. Through our united effort, a portal of light has been effectively opened in both of these nations, spilling over to embrace the entire Middle Eastern region with the power of transforming love and grace.

We all know the power of love knows no boundaries so, like a game of peacekeeper's dominoes, this radiant energy is continuing to spread out to lift neighboring nations into coherent states of inner and outer peace through the support of the Unified Field. 
 
We offer our heartfelt gratitude to each and every one of you for your humble and most appreciated service to the Foundation.

While our first assignment is complete, the Global Peace Operations are just beginning!  WE are readying ourselves to step forward again and to continue our prayerful momentum.   We still call for your assistance in continuing to build the momentum by spreading the word and/or offering a donation.



  Our continued unified group consciousness IS the intervention needed and required! This is truly an opportunity to put all that we know how to do into influential action. We have been trained for this. Together, we can initiate a very positive, catalytic shift in these regions in conflict.

Tiara Kumara,  Children of the Sun Foundation



 

The Middle East peacekeeping delegation was led by James Twyman, bestselling author and musician who has performed concerts for peace in Bosnia, Iraq, Serbia, South Africa, Israel, and Northern Ireland.
  







YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL HELP CREATE LASTING PEACE

All Donations are Tax Deductible in the USA

 
Help us to share this far reaching global program so that people everywhere can be linked and engaged in service as Ambassadors of Peace.

  • Help us to build the Global Peace Operations team
  • Help us create the APP so millions can.. Awaken Profound Peace!
  • Meditate with millions of people spontaneously, at the same time
  • Help us release the program of suffering and bring Peace to Planet Earth

 

           

 

 Our Request of $144,000 kick starts the Global Peace Operations into full action.

The following gives an idea on how these funds will be spent:

PHASE ONE:

10,000:  APP development and launch
9,000:    Audio production (#6 transmissions)
12,000:  Video Production (#6 videos)
16,000:  Program: development/management
15,000:  Social media and marketing
18,000:  Communications: Publicity, newsletter, website 
8,000:    Research and monitoring

10,400:  Middle East Assignment - Syria and Egypt (2 weeks)
              Group travel expenses: 4,800
              Airfare: 3,400
              Food: 1,500
              Audio and Invocation Program: 400
              Other: 300
      
25,000:  Next 2 assignments:(similar to above)

4,600:    Peace Experiment eCourse- Final Productions

10,000:  Indiegogo fees
7,000:    Fundraising campaign management  






 

WE ARE A COLLECTIVE MOVEMENT OF GLOBAL GOODWILL

Children of the Sun Foundation is a non-profit humanitarian movement of Global Goodwill assisting in the planetary consciousness shift.

Our presence as a global campaigner, thought leader, and resource provider of the newly emerging field of quantum healing science promotes unity meditations, global coherence and energy transference to catalyze positive change on mass scale.

Over the last 7 years, our worldwide platform of volunteers has greatly assisted in the accomplished building of a global grid of consciousness which serves as a pathway of communication and energy transfer. See Video.

Our work has been tested with proven results. Our network of volunteers are now trained and prepared to help in this collective movement into the world to command the changes.

We begin now with a massive demonstration of the beneficial influence of prayer and meditation into places of war and conflict.



YOU ARE INVITED TO JOIN US!


www.ChildrenoftheSun.org

story:
On August 9, I published an article in the Daily Beast on the dynamics of refugee assistance in Maban County, South Sudan. The article focused on Tagwa Badredine Al-Hum, a 16 year old refugee from Blue Nile State, Sudan. 

On the most recent national tests, Tagwa scored the highest in the entire country. She finished primary school this year but without assistance will be unable to continue her education. Her most viable option is boarding school in Juba, the capital of South Sudan. Annual tuition is approximately $300 per year. Donations will go towards Tagwa's tuition fees for the coming three years and living and transport costs. 

I was touched by Tagwa's story and the interest expressed from readers in helping her pursue her dream of becoming a journalist. So, I've been in touch with aid workers in Gendrassa camp and started this campaign for a scholarship fund for Tagwa. 

If you are interested in more information, here is the link to the article: Sudan's Smartest Girl

Thanks!

Rebecca

story:
Short Summary

Central Texas Birth Center, an award winning birth center in Georgetown, TX, has been open for almost 3 years and in that time we have built a strong community of families seeking natural minded care.  As Central Texas Birth Center has grown, we have seen an increasing need in the community for a birth center that caters to low income families, and the unique needs they face.  Although we have always offered a deep medicaid discount and been willing to stretch payments for families in need of help, we feel that we could still do more. The Open Arms Project is our attempt to reach out to the community and serve with midwifery care.  It is our goal to accept these families into our care, for little to no cost, and love them through the journey of pregnancy and birth, just as each and every family deserves.  We will accept donations of both money and supplies, as well as work to be approved to accept medicaid. (At this time we are awaiting final approval).  In order to serve as many families as possible, we have taken 3000 square feet in the building just next to Central Texas Birth Center.

 We have 3 beautiful tub rooms for waterbirths and 2 additional labor rooms.  

Central Texas Birth Center is proud to begin offering free and low cost midwifery care to the members of our community in need.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to begin immediately accepting families into the Open Arms Program, we need $85,000. The costs to pay a midwife, an assistant, and cover costs for supplies, is approximately $1500 per birth.  The funds received from this campaign will be able to cover 10 births per month through 6 months.  That's at least 60 families who have the benefit of midwifery care!  We are currently in the process to accept medicaid, and if approved, can bill retroactively back to the date we applied.  Our goal is to be self sufficient for 6 months at which time we will have a better idea if we will receive income from medicaid, or if we must continue to seek income through donations and/or grants.

The Impact

According to a recent study by Urban Institute in Washington, DC (http://www.medscape.com/viewarticle/782723), low income mothers may fare better when cared for by midwives.   On average, the mothers studied had lower rates of cesarean sections, higher birth weight babies, and fewer preterm deliveries than their hospital counterparts.  The unfortunate fact is that many families are unable to afford midwifery care due to high insurance premiums, high deductibles, and no birth centers in Central Texas currently accepting medicaid.  

Midwifery care is a caring, more personalized approach to prenatal care and birth.  The ultimate goal is the same: healthy mom and healthy baby.  However, the path to that goal is very different.  Midwives encourage women to be empowered by the changes happening in their bodies, and educate them fully about those changes.  Natural remedies are sought out when normal pregnancy ailments creep in.  In turn, mothers learn to naturally treat their own families, and thus a circle of good health begins from the seeds planted in midwifery care.


Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to monetary help, we are also seeking the following...

* Queen size headboard, frame, and mattress ( mattress must be new)
* Chairs
* Twin size fitted and flat sheets
* New pillows
* Birth equipment, both reusable and disposable (if you have any half used birth kits laying around we could use them!)
* Refrigerator
* Prayers

story:
YOU can change the world by donating directly to the Social Innovation Program Class of 2013 student scholarship fund!  

  

Here's the most important part: the SIP 2013 cohort will bring students from over 15 institutions, 8 states and 3 countries.

The sponsoring Mason Center for Social Entrepreneurship only has enough funds to grant 10 students scholarships for their $3,750 tuition fee.

With the help of this crowdfunding campaign, we hope to give a total of 15 student scholarships to our dedicated changemakers. 

The Social Innovation Program (SIP) at George Mason University is an intensive five-week institute that prepares aspiring young changemakers to be social entrepreneurs. The SIP approach is premised on the notion that persons in an early stage in the lifecycle of a social entrepreneur can be best prepared for leadership through an intensive residential cohort experience that includes innovative academic and experiential components.

The first week of the program features daily coursework focusing on core concepts of nonprofit leadership, social entrepreneurship and community change. During the remainder of the program, seasoned social entrepreneurs train apprentices in teams how to apply their newly learned skills. Local nonprofits and municipal agencies present participants with real world challenges to solve. Additionally, each SIP team will employ lean startup and business model generation tools to create and discover innovative business models for social impact. 

Learning at SIP is not limited to the formal curriculum! SIP’s brown bag lunch series brings in practicing social entrepreneurs to meet with students and provide an inside look at this career path. SIP Program Assistants organize recreational activities, including at least 2 volunteer activities, to acquaint students with the DC metropolitan region and its communities’ needs.  SIP participants are also frequently invited to regional events that coincide with the program.

story:
Short Summary

I am Mirandy Cook.  I was until recently a youth services assistant at the Port Townsend City Library.  Most of you know me as the person who did the weekly children's programs.  What many of you don't know is that I studied Early Childhood Development, Storytelling, and Theories of Childhood Play at Goddard College.  This lead me to actually research what components and environmental conditions best facilitated early learning particularly in the intimate setting of a story time program.  I worked academically and pragmatically developing my programs over two years of research.  What I discovered was that music, narrative, and other activities and structure that promoted a group cohesion naturally opened the preschooler's mind to new ideas and greater conceptual retention.  This is why my programs had a kind of shared culture of little rituals, songs and art objects.  This is why they were so interactive and open ended.  This is why the atmosphere was one of caring and sharing.  Love doesn't just make your child feel better.  It helps her learn.

My school will be the children’s school. It will have a natural open ended aesthetic led by the curiosity and creativity of the children themselves.  There will be imaginative play, process based real art, community building, and lots of music making and storytelling.  All the scarves and parachute and dancing ribbons, treasure hunts, simple yoga, Spanish, Sign Language, and stone soup will be there.  It will be their own magical space where minds open up to all the possibilities and the children themselves will own their new found discoveries.  I envision a jug band concert.  I see nature as a central teacher.  I believe compassion should be a core curriculum.  Mindfulness is a state of learning. 

What We Need & What You Get

Since my departure from the library, I have been overwhelmed by the love and  support of so many of my friends, co-workers, and most especially, the parents of my story time children.  Many have insisted on helping more.  Many have suggested that I open a preschool.  Secretly, it has been a dream in the back of my head, and at the front of my heart, for many years.  I have felt that one hour a week was just not enough to sufficiently impact those precious beautiful children.  So, here I am, answering my life's actual calling - to open Singing Tree Preschool.  I do, though need some help.  I need start up funds.  These will cover initial rent, deposits, insurance, licensing, marketing material, and signage.  I figure $5,000 for all that.  Next the school will need furniture, cabinetry, manipulative/play stations, activity tables, books, instruments, and a play structure.  Natural materials and open ended items are crucial.  I envision a farmers market station inside with actual flower/vegetable beds outside.  I would love to have a little playhouse where lots of imagination can flourish.   

So what do you get for all of this generosity.  Well, for starters you get my undying gratitude just for visiting this page.  For pledges, there is the customary thank you card, a free digital copy of The Singing Tree picture book shown on the intro video, original whimsical illustration art prints by Mirandy's sister Arrolynn (8x10), and art prints of my husband's photography (approximately 11x17 or 17x25 depending on donation amount).  Please check out our gallery specifically set up for this occasion by hitting the "gallery" link at the top of this page. (When you choose perks that include an illustration or photo print make sure you email us with your image selection.)  For a $500 donation all of these items will be included plus a commemorative plaque proudly displayed at the school.  An extremely generous $1,000 donation will include everything plus a plaque and an additional living "singing" tree in honor of the kindness.  This tree will hopefully be on the school grounds, but circumstances may require it to be relocated to another public space in town.  It will of course include its own plaque with a poetic statement of gratitude honoring the generous donor.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations are of course not the only way to help.  Spread the word.  Let the cat out the bag.  Run through the streets like Paul Revere.  Word of mouth is a wonderful way to share.  There is one fairly big item I am currently in search of - a warm, inviting, central school location!  A little house with a great room and a nice fenced in yard would be perfect.  The owners would have to agree to allow a preschool on the premises.  If anyone could find a welcoming host, that would be amazing.
