Short Summary I am Mirandy Cook.  I was until recently a youth services assistant at the Port Townsend City Library.  Most of you know me as the person who did the weekly children's programs.  What many of you don't know is that I studied Early Childhood Development, Storytelling, and Theories of Childhood Play at Goddard College.  This lead me to actually research what components and environmental conditions best facilitated early learning particularly in the intimate setting of a story time program.  I worked academically and pragmatically developing my programs over two years of research.  What I discovered was that music, narrative, and other activities and structure that promoted a group cohesion naturally opened the preschooler's mind to new ideas and greater conceptual retention.  This is why my programs had a kind of shared culture of little rituals, songs and art objects.  This is why they were so interactive and open ended.  This is why the atmosphere was one of caring and sharing.  Love doesn't just make your child feel better.  It helps her learn.

My school will be the children’s school. It will have a natural open ended aesthetic led by the curiosity and creativity of the children themselves.  There will be imaginative play, process based real art, community building, and lots of music making and storytelling.  All the scarves and parachute and dancing ribbons, treasure hunts, simple yoga, Spanish, Sign Language, and stone soup will be there.  It will be their own magical space where minds open up to all the possibilities and the children themselves will own their new found discoveries.  I envision a jug band concert.  I see nature as a central teacher.  I believe compassion should be a core curriculum.  Mindfulness is a state of learning. 
What We Need & What You Get
 Since my departure from the library, I have been overwhelmed by the love and  support of so many of my friends, co-workers, and most especially, the parents of my story time children.  Many have insisted on helping more.  Many have suggested that I open a preschool.  Secretly, it has been a dream in the back of my head, and at the front of my heart, for many years.  I have felt that one hour a week was just not enough to sufficiently impact those precious beautiful children.  So, here I am, answering my life's actual calling - to open Singing Tree Preschool.  I do, though need some help.  I need start up funds.  These will cover initial rent, deposits, insurance, licensing, marketing material, and signage.  I figure $5,000 for all that.  Next the school will need furniture, cabinetry, manipulative/play stations, activity tables, books, instruments, and a play structure.  Natural materials and open ended items are crucial.  I envision a farmers market station inside with actual flower/vegetable beds outside.  I would love to have a little playhouse where lots of imagination can flourish.   
So what do you get for all of this generosity.  Well, for starters you get my undying gratitude just for visiting this page.  For pledges, there is the customary thank you card, a free digital copy of The Singing Tree picture book shown on the intro video, original whimsical illustration art prints by Mirandy's sister Arrolynn (8x10), and art prints of my husband's photography (approximately 11x17 or 17x25 depending on donation amount).  Please check out our gallery specifically set up for this occasion by hitting the "gallery" link at the top of this page. (When you choose perks that include an illustration or photo print make sure you email us with your image selection.)  For a $500 donation all of these items will be included plus a commemorative plaque proudly displayed at the school.  An extremely generous $1,000 donation will include everything plus a plaque and an additional living "singing" tree in honor of the kindness.  This tree will hopefully be on the school grounds, but circumstances may require it to be relocated to another public space in town.  It will of course include its own plaque with a poetic statement of gratitude honoring the generous donor.

    Other Ways You Can Help Donations are of course not the only way to help.  Spread the word.  Let the cat out the bag.  Run through the streets like Paul Revere.  Word of mouth is a wonderful way to share.  There is one fairly big item I am currently in search of - a warm, inviting, central school location!  A little house with a great room and a nice fenced in yard would be perfect.  The owners would have to agree to allow a preschool on the premises.  If anyone could find a welcoming host, that would be amazing.

story:
Our Story
Zomppa is an innovative, 501(c) 3 nonprofit that aims to transform the relationship between food and people through awareness, dialogue, and education. 

Our mission is tied to our beliefs that:
  • The current food system is broken and unless each of us does something about it, our species and our planet are in serious trouble.
  • Good recipes not only taste good, but also promote the sustainability of culture, a fair food system, and the Earth.

We plan to do this through an integrated food advocacy platform that brings food back to the central role of our lives by:
  • influencing public opinion with an interactive, online cafÃ©, and international food magazine; and 
  • empowering children through Zomppabus, a mobile food atlas and online classroom.

What We Need & What You Get
We need your help to get Zomppabus up and running on our Online Classroom and on the road with our partner, the Sol Food Mobile Farm, a school bus that runs on veggie-oil, that will travel around the U.S. in 2012

Zomppa seeks $30,000 to:
  • produce fun, educational videos on Neda's ABCs about food and healthy eating for kids;
  • expand our Healthy Eating and Global Exploration curriculum;
  • secure the hard/software to connect classrooms around the world and on the Sol Food Mobile Farm.

Website: www.zomppa.com and www.bus.zomppa.com
Facebook: www.facebook.com/zomppa
Twitter: www.twitter.com/zomppa
Email: info@zomppa.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ynanna Djehuty. I am an Afro-Dominican woman born and raised in the Bronx. I am a writer and certified birth doula. In October 2009, I published my book, ‘Hija De Mi Madre’ (My Mother’s Daughter), which is a combination of memoirs, poems and research material that describes the effects of race on identity. I am currently working on the next part of my journey – one of deep healing and transcendence. As I work on the forthcoming book, Mujer Negra: Evolution, I am sharing my ideas about transcendence and breaking cycles with larger audiences. I have been invited by the National Association of Hispanic and Latino Studies to present two abstracts at the upcoming conference in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. I am in need of assistance to reach the conference.

What I Need & What You Get

I need $2000 to be able to get to Baton Rouge, Louisiana. This money will go to:

  • Conference registration fee
  • Roundtrip flight from Syracuse to Baton Rouge
  • Lodging for 3 nights
  • Submissions to the national organization’s Monograph Series and the Journal of Intercultural Disciplines
  • Perks! For your help, I have a short list of perks that I will gladly gift you for your own special gift to me:
    • $10  – Two exclusive poetry tracks by yours truly that have not been released to the public
    • $50– A signed copy of my first book, Hija De Mi Madre
    • $100– A signed copy of “The Abyss Stares Back,” a limited edition collection of essays that my forthcoming book are based on
    • $500 – All of the above + a long distance Reiki healing session
  • All of the funds raised will go towards getting to the conference.

The Impact

Giving a voice to an underrepresented group of women, Afro-Latinas, is crucial to their healing. In the last 3 years, the power of my personal narrative has touched many audiences and has planted seeds that I have had the honor of nurturing. My presence at conferences such as this one gives me the opportunity to make connections with more colleges, universities and institutions of higher learning. Reaching this particular demographic of students is important due to the influential nature of an undergraduate career on the life of an individual. The following is a short list of the impact I have had on the people I have shared my story and research with:

  • Encouraging college students to explore their Afro-Latino heritage
  • Sparked many discussions on the effects of losing touch with your self
  • Mentorship to two women on their own path of healing
  • Inspired some who have read my book to cut their processed hair and embrace their natural hair
  • A following of over 1,000 people who seek inspiration from my social media sites daily
  • Hija De Mi Madre was added to a high school reading list. A graduate of that school got in touch with me to share how much my story has inspired her

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t contribute? No worries! You can still help me by getting the word out and share my campaign. Thanks for stopping by!

story:
Short Summary

I recently went to Guatemala to my 20th High School reunion. While reconnecting with old friends I found out about one of my classmates, Cinthya Vallejo. She was an attorney in Guatemala, but her focus changed in 2004 after doing social work helping children that were being abused and abandoned. She wanted to open a home for these children were they could be taken care of and educated. Finally in 2010, she opened the home God Bless the Children. I decided I want to help her. She left her job as a lawyer and now dedicates her time to take care of 14 kids that she speaks of as they are her own.  I know she struggles sometimes to even pay the rent, and I hope I can help her help her kids. Her story touched me enough to try to do something for them.

What We Need  

At first I had the idea of raising funds to get the kids Christmas toys, but I know that diapers, food and shelter come first. She told me that she felt that God always provided for her, that she's been lucky to get donations when she needed them most. I am hoping you will help me, help these kids.

The Impact

The children she takes care of come form different parts of the country and different situations, but at God Bless The Children they take care of them with love.  I only wish to help her keep taking care of them. I have never done a campaign like this, but I really believe that helping this cause we can make a real difference.

I will bring all the money I collect from this campaign when I go to Guatemala for Christmas. I will send an update with photos of the home when I visit and give her the donation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
This campaign was a great success... visit my new

website www.booksmatter.org to help me continue

to ship 1,000s of books to Ghana schools.

 

Books4Ghana  

What's this Campaign About?

Education is the key to many of the world's challenges.

Books are a huge part of education.

In Ghana schools, books are very scarce (similar to the situation in many developing countries).

I shipped 800 books to Bright Future School (k-gr 9) in the fall and the impact of that shipment was huge and immediate.

I have collected 3,000+ books that I will ship in January.

 

This campaign is very cost effective and your contributions will have an immediate impact:

  • There is no bureaucracy involved and no red tape
  • My campaign closes late January and I will ship immediately
  • The books will arrive in Ghana at the end of March
  • By mid April the books will be in the schools and the students will begin benefitting from them

We all know the power of education. At the very least, BOOKS SHOULD BE A RIGHT, NOT A PRIVILEGE.

 

The Money

The bulk of the money will be spent on the following:

To ship 10 shipping containers (barrels/drums): $150 ea. = $1500

To transport 10 containers from the port to the schools: $50 ea. = $500

To transport 10 containers from my house to shipper: $150 truck rental w.gas

The cost of 10 containers: $20 ea = $200

Perks and mailing: $200

Also, there are indiegogo charges.

That's less than $1 per book. Not bad since some of the books are $100 textbooks and most are a minimum $10 value.

If I receive more than my goal, I'm constantly gathering up books to send (I'm addicted) and will possibly have more than 10 containers by shipping time anyway. This will not be my last shipment.

About Me

My name is Keith Goddard and I have been a teacher in Toronto for almost 20 years. I have travelled to Ghana, West Africa four times in the past and my wife was born and schooled there. Most of the 3,000+ books in this shipment have been donated from three Toronto area schools and private citizens of Toronto. Most of those people I found through ads on Kijiji or Craig's List. Besides Bright Future School, I will also be donating 500 of the books (that are at a high school level) to a high school in that neighbourhood in Keta, where many of the Bright Future School graduates go to. It would be tragic if, when they went off to high school, there were no books for them. I have many amazing high school level text books and fiction books. I also have about 500 university level books, and most of those I will be giving to a newly built university in the Volta Region (Volta University). I am amazed by the qualtiy of many of the university texts that were donated (math, science, psychology, sociology, medicine, etc.).

I plan on providing books to all the needy schools in Ghana, one school at a time!


BOOKS COUNT!!


If you're not able to contribute, please pass the word on by telling your friends or use the Indiegogo tools to share on FB or Twitter.


Thanks:)

story:
Hello Friends, extended friends an family! I've just returned from India  where Tsering Gellek and I ran a Business Beyond Self Interest conference.  Two members of our diverse group of business people, educators, social activists and monks, were Charlotte Leech and Sanat Kumar two wonderful people and are working to bring education and self-sufficiency to a portion of rural India.  The attached video was produced in 2008. Their school opened in 2014 and they are now are looking for support for 30 students. The cost of materials, etc. for a year for one child is only about $400.  Since we are contributing directly to the school, a small contribution can actually change a life!  I'm supporting one student and extending the opportunity to share in this happiness to others.  My hope is to raise an additional $1,500 to support 3 more children, though small and large contributions. With the power of a group, even a $5.00 contributions helps! 

With best wishes for you in the new year,
Linda Copenhagen
Below is a description of the program.
Loka is seeking sponsors for 30 children in order to provide them fulltime education at Loka’s school, starting beginning 2015. The children whom Loka educates -currently in the form of extra classes in the afternoon- are educationally disadvantaged due to lack of good schools in the region. Loka’s aim is to help improve this situation the soonest and we kindly ask your support in doing so! Sponsoring a child costs about $400 per year and includes all study materials.  And why not make this Christmas extra special by investing in a small-scale and local project that provides value education, empowers women and believes in sustainable growth and a green world….

story:
Summary

Gender gaps in education are real: Girls face greater hurdles than boys in getting an education and are more likely to leave school long before boys. Girls can't or may not have access to education, computers and the Internet. Home and family obligations, lack of transportation, low-literacy and cultural norms discourage - if not deny - access. Focusing on organizations and schools that specifically support girls education is one way to overcome these barriers.

  • Countries included in the initiative: Ghana, Kenya, Liberia, Mali, South Africa, Tanzania, Zambia, and Zimbabwe
  • We are working to add: Dominican Republic, Honduras, Malawi, Pakistan, Puerto Rico, and Uganda

Computers for Girls works to bring computers pre-loaded with educational programing to regions in need, as well as train teachers to use the programs. By promoting technological fluency in girls around the world, C4G hopes to broaden the range of opportunities available to our students. 

Needs & Perks

  • Every dollar counts!
  • Become a member of Computers for Girls (C4G) by donating $50 to receive a unique, glass-fused star decoration. These stars are hand-made by artist Janet Auman and no two are alike.
  • Members will receive monthly updates on C4G projects, as well as have their name listed on our top contributor website
  • We have a donor who will match your donations for the first 70 star decorations!

The Impact - Friends and Family Campaign

If you can help, we will provide you with a draft email and Facebook posting for you to use with your friends & family.  We will list your name on our Donate page with the part of WCE for which you are raising funds so your friends & family will be able to click on your name and we can let you know as they donate.

Why Do We Care?

“Personally, I'm very excited about the computer science content on these computers and the growth resources. Technical literacy provides a huge leg up in accessing modern markets, and knowing how to design and build products is invaluable for those aspiring to start companies and organizations. Teaching girls how to program and how to find support in pursuing higher education and independent business is a powerful combination that will lead to a new generation of strong women leaders at the head of technologies pushing social change. Across the world, girls are less likely to finish school, less likely to pursue higher education, and thus less likely to follow career paths that lead to higher-paying, more specialized jobs. This trend is simply unacceptable. The Computers for Girls initiative strives to enable and empower girls to stay in school, to pursue career roles as leaders and innovators, and to serve as valuable peers and role models to other girls.” 
- Vicki Niu – C4G content developer, Stanford Undergraduate Student 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar counts, but so does every friend:

  • Make some noise about our campaign - share our World Computer Exchange and Computers for Girls Facebook page!
  • Follow us on Twitter @WCE_org
  • Follow us on Instagram @WorldComputerExchange
  • Email us - volunteer@worldcomputerexchange.org
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you to our friends and family for your support in improving education for girls

story:
Greetings, friends!

We are the HAMK Model United Nations delegation, a group of 8 students from all around the world united by the ultimate goal of taking part in the World MUN 2015, the biggest and the best conference of its kind. Our home city is Valkeakoski, a small place in the middle of Finland. The destination is 7000km away, on the very opposite side of the planet, in Seoul. The preparation for an event like this is a long path, which poses various challenges for those willing to participate in it.

One of the biggest challenges by far is raising funds. And even though a tremendous work has been done so far and most of the funds have been raised, we still ask for support. 

To make it easier for you to learn who we are and what we do, we have created a short video. It was created with extreme love, care and appreciation. 
We highly appreciate every small piece of donation and would like to say big thanks to every person who has decided or will decide to support our delegation. In case like this, every coin helps!

We are grateful for the time you spent to go through this text.

May your friends always make your path smooth and easy,

Sincerely,

HAMK MUN Delegation
story_txt: Greetings, friends!We are the HAMK Model United Nations delegation, a group of 8 students from all around the world united by the ultimate goal of taking part in the World MUN 2015, the biggest and the best conference of its kind. Our home city is Valkeakoski, a small place in the middle of Finland. The destination is 7000km away, on the very opposite side of the planet, in Seoul. The preparation for an event like this is a long path, which poses various challenges for those willing to participate in it.One of the biggest challenges by far is raising funds. And even though a tremendous work has been done so far and most of the funds have been raised, we still ask for support. To make it easier for you to learn who we are and what we do, we have created a short video. It was created with extreme love, care and appreciation. We highly appreciate every small piece of donation and would like to say big thanks to every person who has decided or will decide to support our delegation. In case like this, every coin helps!We are grateful for the time you spent to go through this text.May your friends always make your path smooth and easy,Sincerely,HAMK MUN Delegation

story:
L'objectif général de la campagne
  • agrandir le laboratoire pour combler un manque d’espace pour la conservation 
  • installer un système de contrôle de température et d’humidité
  • installer un système de rangement mobile à haute densité
Ceci va permettre au MPE d'avoir de meilleur conditions de conservation pour ces collections en plus d'avoir l'espace nécessaire pour recevoir une importante collection académique de fossiles que nous attendons pour 2015.

------------------------------------

General objectives of the fundraiser

  • expand the laboratory to compensate for a lack of storage space
  • install a temperature and humidity control system
  • install a high density mobile shelving system

This will enable the MPE to have better conservation conditions for its collections, and to have a proper space for an academic fossil collection we are expecting before the start of 2015.

------------------------------------

Ce que nous avons besoins et ce que vous recevez en retour

Coûts et financement du projet

  • budget total de 22 000 $. Dépenses : 6 000 $ pour l’ agrandissement du laboratoire, 3 000 $ pour le système de contrôle de température et d’humidité, et 13 000 $ pour le système de rangement mobile à haute densité
  • financement du projet par collecte de fonds (22 000 $) provenant des membres et amis du Musée

------------------------------------

What We Need & What You Get

Project costs and funding

  • total budget of 22,000$. Costs: 6,000$ for enlarging the laboratory, 3,000$ for a temperature and humidity control system, and 13,000$ for a high density mobile shelving system
  • financing of the project will come from members and friends of the Museum

------------------------------------

Les retombés

  • Vous permettez au MPE d'avoir de meilleurs conditions de conservation pour ses collections 
  • Espaces adéquats pour les étudiants durant leur emplois d'été
  • Vous aidez à bâtir la première collection provincial de fossiles du Québec
  • Dans la cas où la campagne dépasse son objectif, les sommes accumulés serviront à l'achat d'équipements de préparation comme : une Micro-sableuse (10,000$), nouvel ordinateur (avec logiciel de base de données), différents outils de laboratoire (lampes, loupes, pinces, etc.)

------------------------------------

The impact

  • You enable the MPE to get proper conservation space for its collections, 
  • Proper space for the students who work here during summer jobs.
  • Help build the first provincial fossil collection in Québec
  • Extra money will fund the purchase of preparation tools such as : Micro-sandblaster system (10,000$), new computer (with database software), various lab equipment (lamps, magnifying lenses, pincers, etc.)

------------------------------------

Le Musée de paléontologie et de l'évolution (MPE)

  • est un organisme sans but lucratif et de bienfaisance reconnu qui fête ses 19 ans en octobre 2014
  • détient une collection d’environ 60 000 fossiles qui sont conservés à son laboratoire à Montréal
  • présente des expositions temporaires, organise des colloques et des fouilles sur le terrain pour le public
  • regroupe une soixantaine de membres bénévoles qui maintiennent les diverses activités du musée
  • www.mpe-fossiles.org

------------------------------------

The Musée de paléontologie et de l'évolution (MPE)

  • is a non-profit organization and a charity that celebrated its 19th birthday in 2014;
  • owns a 60,000 specimen fossil collection that is preserved at its laboratory in Montréal;
  • organizes fieldwork for the benefit of the public during the summer season;
  • includes about sixty volunteer members who maintain the museum and its various activities.  
  • www.mpe-fossils.org

is a non-profit organization and a charity that celebrated its 19th birthday in 2014;

organizes fieldwork for the benefit of the public during the summer season;

includes about sixty volunteer members who maintain the museum and its various activities.

story:
Short Summary

Nazareth Academy (www.nazacademy.org) is an independent high school for girls located in Wakefield, MA. We are dedicated to the idea that young women thrive in a single sex educational environment, and we prove this every day with the success of our girls. Naz girls have been accepted to top tier colleges, competing with students from much larger schools. Our Trinity Choir has sung for Pope Benedict in Italy and opened shows in Boston for the Rockettes. Nazareth Academy was recently featured in a Boston Globe story chronicling our first three years of operation. We work with Special Olympics, hosting a basketball game between our girls and a local Special Olympics team. We have won awards in drama festivals, field teams in volleyball, softball, basketball, and tennis, not to mention our Mathletes, but we have yet to compete in the realm of science.

Three years ago, the parents and friends of Nazareth Academy converted a run down elementary school into a welcoming space for education. We may lack a gymnasium and athletic fields, or a functioning cafeteria as found at other local schools, but are extremely proud of what we have done with our limited facilities to date. Now it is time to take the next step and build our girls a state of the art science and technology laboratory for biology, chemistry and physics classes.

Check out our Facebook page for even more information about Nazareth Academy!

What We Need & What You Get

Our current "science lab" is a converted elementary school classroom with a small sink in the back. With no real facilities, the girls are only able to perform the most rudimentary "kitchen science". In order for our girls to remain competitive in the important areas of science, technology, engineering, and mathematics, they need to supplement their classroom instruction with practical hands on experiments. This requires an overhaul of the laboratory room to include plumbed gas, air, and vacuum, as well as lab benches with functional sinks. To enable chemistry work, we would also need proper safety equipment including chemical cabinets, an emergency shower with drainage, and several eye wash stations.

In addition to facilities improvements, we also need all of the requisite lab equipment: incubators and centriguges, Bunsen burners, microscopes and dissection kits, beakers and graduated cylinders. For chemistry, we need a proper stockroom of chemicals and physics instruction requires ramps, pulleys, motion sensors, timers, and many other items for measuring mass, velocity, or distance. Without these tools of the trade, our girls will struggle to compete in the ever increasing competitive market of college acceptance in the sciences.

Currently, school tuition covers roughly 80% of daily operational costs The remainder is raised through a dedicated group of parents running fundraisers throughout the year, but these efforts cannot accomodate large project plans like this.

This is where all of you come in. If you believe in education, and specifically in providing a solid foundation for young women to develop in the areas of science and engineering, please contribute to our campaign. If you are unable to contribute at this time, you can still help by spreading the word. Link to our campaign on your Facebook page, send a Tweet, or mention us on your blog. Point all of your friends and family and neighbors to our campaign. Each new set of eyes that see our story will help get us closer to our goal. 

Finally, since we are a recognized 501(c)(3) non-profit charitable organization, your contribution will be tax deductible. 

The Impact

Many studies show a continued bias against women in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) careers which begins in the junior high and high school years. Nazareth Academy's single sex education model already removes many of the inherent biases found in co-educational institutions, and can overcome most of the other hurdles by providing a strong introduction and foundation for our girls in these important areas.

Your gift will help us realize this goal, and increase the potential for young women to explore and excel in STEM careers. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Our main goal is to build our science and technology center, and stock it with all of the necessary equipment and supplies. We also have many achievable smaller goals, where your contribution will be put to good use as well. Even if we do not make our $100,000 goal, any amount raised can be used for chemicals and small equipment, or to add more sinks and cabinets to our science lab. Each dollar can be utilized in an important way to maximize our ability to educate these young women.

We would like for our message to reach a million people, and you can help us get there. Even if you are unable to contribute at this time, help us spread the word.

story:
We are.....

Solomon's Harvest, members of Bethel Campus Fellowship (BCF), a campus ministry that God is using radically transform the college experience on campuses worldwide.

Our goal is to raise $3000 to send students to BCF's Annual National Conference, a conference that has touched and changed every single one of our lives. 



This year we are expecting 1500 students from as many as 35 colleges, high schools,and several church youth groups from across the United States, Canada, and the United Kingdom.

What We Need 

To meet the budget for the conference, members of BCF have volunteered to raise $1000.00 each. Each of us has volunteered to help this cause and understand that we work even better as a team. Your donation will be used to:

  • Sponsor students who desire to attend this conference but do not have the means
  • It will help us to secure hotel accommodation, transportation from our various campuses, and meals for the three days. 

Your donation is tax deductible. 

We pray that God will lead you to support our goal with a one time donation of $10, $25, $50, $100, $150, $250, $500, or $1000.

God bless you as you support us!

-Solomon's Wealth

What  Students Are Saying About BCF...

"BCF gave me a place where I could encounter God's love thorugh His people; people who lived out the word of God and encouraged me in my pursuit of real love."

- Sophia N

“If it were not for BCF, I more than likely would not be here today. The conference last year wrecked me and I’ll never be the same.”  

- Temi O.

“God used BCF to lead me to Him. It is in this ministry that I first caught a glimpse of what it meant to be on fire for God. It remains the ministry that gives me the desire to delve deeper spiritually in order to maintain an engaging, loving, experiential relationship with the Lord.”

- Victoria P.

“BCF means everything to me. It has truly allowed me to understand what it means to walk with Christ through fellowship with other young believers. My walk has been forever changed because of it.”

- Jamal N.

“BCF was the catalyst for me to experience a relationship with God and His people in a  new and awesome way. BCF showed me Christ in a way no one else has before.”

-Janicia M.

“BCF has been a catalyst for spiritual growth in my life. God has used so many different people in the ministry to build my faith, broaden my understanding of God, challenge me to continue learning,and so much more. Being a part of BCF has showed me time and time again, that God is real and that He changes lives for the better.”

- Idara I

“BCF showed me what true friendship looked like."

- Lu A

story:
Hi friends!

So some of you may know I have been traveling the country as an actress working at different theatres saving pennies for the big move to finally one day move to NYC. Well the day is near and I have saved enough for first months rent and fees!

What I am asking is for any amount of sum to help me for my first month there to get settled and on my feet as I try and find a job... and partly so I don't starve or in debt after draining all my savings just to secure a roof over my head.

I know times are hard and no one is made of money, but a dollar can go a long way in helping me call NYC my home and finally pursue my dreams!

I am so grateful to have the greatest friends and family in the world, and without your support and constant words of encouragement and belief in me I would not be where I am today.

story:
Dear Friends and Family,

We are writing to let you know about an exciting opportunity we have to be a part of the James127 project which helps the women and children of Tobati, Paraguay. The James127 project is based on James 1:27, "What God considers to be pure and genuine religion is this: to take care of orphans and widows in their suffering..."   The women and children of Tobati definitely fall into this category.  There is very little work available in Paraguay and the men of the area usually go to Argentina to find work to support their families  and soon after abandon them for another woman there.  In many cases the mothers of these families also then go to Argentina to find work and are unable or unwilling to return to the children they left behind.

The intent of the James127 project is to support the families of Tobati emotionally, physically and spiritually. We will be building an education center, constructing a donated playground, delivering over 500 donated wheelchairs, creating/delivering art for the education center, and connecting local families with churches for followup support.

(Please see our video for more details)

We would like to give you the opportunity to be a part of this project with us!

How you can help:

1. Thoughts and prayers as we prepare for, and participate in this trip.

2. Financial support - The cost of our trip (total for both of us) is $5900 and includes transportation, hotel, travel insurance, meals, transfers, construction materials, and follow-up funding. (50% of our funds must be turned into James127 by May 1st and the other 50% by June 15th)  

For those of you who feel like you would like to partner with us financially you can contribute via this secure website.  If you would like to support us through a check you would need to make it out to Su Refugio Ministries and contact us for our address. 

We want to thank you in advance for all your support and promise to keep you updated through Facebook and/or email along with this website.

Sharing the love of God with those who may feel unloved or abandoned,

David and Gracie Rhoads

story:
Dear Friends of Youth Rugby,

     We are Rugby NY, the governing body for youth rugby in the state of New York. We are a 501c Non-profit organisztion.  We fall under the direction of USA Rugby.  As you can see from the logo above, we have created Project 2020 with the goal of putting a boy or a girl from NY on the 2020 USA Olympic Rugby team.  We are confident that we can achive this goal, but we believe that the future olympian has yet to pick up a rugby ball.  In order to achive this very lofty goal, we must introduce rugby to as many kids in NY as we can.  We have 3 areas on which we focus: 

1. PE Classes

2. Youth programs, such as, YMCA or Boys and Girls Clubs.

3. High School Rugby teams

 

    Our goal is simple- we would would like to supply every Gym class, every YMCA, and every HS team with free equipment.  School and Program budgets are at an all time low.  We do not want to give sport directors a finacial excuse for saying no to rugby.  Rugby already has an negitive reputation, so we don't want finances to be the, proverbial "nail in the coffin." 

  We would like to rasise $15,000, with which we will purchase 2 years worth of equipment for NY youth rugby. 

    For corporate donations you have the opportunity to have your logo seen by hundreds of thousands of potentional customers. 

   We thank you in advance for helping us reach our goal.  Remember that it "takes a village" to send a child to the Olympics!

Cheers,

Rugby NY

story:
Lindell's Passion

Dad lived his life with a passion to invest and develop young leaders.   We want to honor that passion at this time by asking that rather then sending flowers that will be gone in just a few days, that you join us in honoring his life and legacy by giving to this campaign.  

What We Plan To Do

We are going to select a few of the ministries and organizations that he was a part of or supported the most and give them a gift in his honor.  The organisatoins will be specific in that they invest in the development of young spiritual leaders.  

The Impact

The impact will be that young leaders will be encouraged and developed that will continue to make a difference in his honor.  

 

Thank You!!!

We are going to select a few of the ministries and organizations that he was a part of or supported the most and give them a gift in his honor.  The organisatoins will be specific in that they invest in the development of young spiritual leaders.  


The Impact
The impact will be that young leaders will be encouraged and developed that will continue to make a difference in his honor.  
 
Thank You!!!

story:
Our Mission:

To create a world that we are honored to leave to future generations, through the empowerment of individuals, the connection of communities and the preservation of the Earth.

 

Our Concept:

The purpose of Solomon Exchange is to encourage people to help each other and to facilitate the matching of qualified volunteers with those in need of help. Our goal is to increase the quality of life for individual members, business members, sponsored nonprofit associates, the community, the country and the world as a whole.

The idea is to create a membership organization for people who are concerned about the state of the world and motivated to help but perhaps don’t know how. One’s focus could be on helping people, animals or the environment. The quantity and variety of global problems that affect us all seem to be constantly on the rise, while at the same time our personal and financial problems continue to grow. When a person feels preoccupied with acquiring the resources needed for survival it can become extremely difficult to do anything for their fellow humans, animals or the environment, much less to affect global change. We believe that it does not have to be like this but many people just don’t realize it yet. In fact, real positive change is possible on every level and it begins with each of us. When one person makes a connection to another and helps them in some way, change is underway. Our goal is to make these connections.

Solomon Exchange is a nonprofit organization formed to increase volunteerism and encourage people to work together. Solomon Exchange supports other nonprofits and plans to assist all work currently being done to improve the health of the environment, humane animal treatment and the right every human being has to clean water, food, hygienic living conditions, health care, education, equality and personal peace. Solomon Exchange is for anyone willing to volunteer a few hours every year to contribute to any of the above causes or any comparable cause not mentioned above.

After an individual registers with Solomon Exchange the new member will gain access to the website. At the website the member can search through a variety of volunteering opportunities and choose one or more to participate in. Every time a member volunteers at a sponsored Solomon Exchange activity the member will earn social merit points that they can proudly display on their profile page. Once a member has volunteered approximately 10 hours of time they will gain access to the favor exchange feature of Solomon Exchange where members can exchange points for favors ranging from activities like a ride to the grocery store to painting your house!

People may even pick up a few new skills or find a new hobby or discover a natural ability. Most importantly Solomon Exchange members will know they did something that made a difference for someone else. People will remember how they used to honestly believe they could change the world. Solomon Exchange is here to say we still can change the world, we can have hope and we will always have the freedom to dream.

      

About Me:

My name is Sarah Solomon. I am the founder of Solomon Exchange and a single mother. Last year I graduated cum laude from Sonoma State University with a bachelor degree in each of these fields: anthropology, psychology and human development.

I suppose my choices of study could have been foretold looking back at my childhood. When I was a little girl my mother took me to see a show in San Francisco but I did not have any dress shoes, so I got to wear my mother’s two-sizes-too big heels. As I wobbled at a frantic pace to keep up with my mom some men sitting on the sidewalk began to laugh. Embarrassment and fear immediately brought me directly to my mother’s side and she explained to me that those men were homeless. I had a difficult time comprehending the concept of how someone could have no home. So the next day during my second grade art time I used my graph paper to create a plan to convert empty hotels into homes for those men and others like them. There would have to be enough rooms in the world for everybody to have one. I believed problems could have a simple solution.

Through the years I, or someone very close to me, has battled through depression, domestic abuse, homelessness, alcoholism, cancer, miscarriages, sexual assault and autism, to name a few.  Life can be terrifying and the larger the fear becomes the bigger the problem seems until it is almost impossible handle. Sometimes we don’t want to tell our friends and family, maybe they are having an even harder time in life, maybe they are not there for you, maybe you feel too embarrassed or ashamed. Although a friend, a family member, a stranger at the grocery store or the first real human voice after a series of automatic operators may not be able to cure what ails you but that sense of relief you receive invigorates you for the next round.

If only there was some way to use modern social networking tools to connect people to causes and each other in an easy way. Even better if people were encouraged to help out and felt like their time made a difference…

Then it happened to me.  It was like that light bulb switched ‘on’ and some type of gear broke through the cobwebs and began to move. It is similar to that feeling when love makes life feel full of possibilities again and you are able to see the world in the childlike way, before reality has a chance to stomp out the birth of dreams. It felt like the solution to a problem I had been trying to solve my entire life.

The quantity and variety of global problems that affect us all seem to be constantly on the rise while at the same time our personal and financial problems continue to grow. When a person feels preoccupied with acquiring the resources needed for survival it can become extremely difficult to do anything for their fellow humans, animals or the environment, much less to affect global change.

This is what is going on. We are ignoring the problems, they are growing, we feel powerless and just hope someone in the future will correct all the problems.  My question is:  Why can't you be that person in the future that gets the ball rolling? What if every one of us became that person, even in some small way? Imagine the possibilities! Using our knowledge, our technology and our resources we can improve the lives of individuals, of communities and of Mother Earth. Better late than never! Join us and we will improve the world, one little bit at a time.

 

What We Need & How It Will Help:

This social project is in the earliest, and probably most expensive, part of its creation period: the start up phase. This campaign is to get this project to move forward and start future revenue streams, but it will take a lot more funding to get to a point where we are able to launch.  I am confident that this project will qualify as a tax-exempt nonprofit but it would not hurt having a consultation with a lawyer and a CPA. Once we are have the money to incorporate, we will be able to further fund the project with loans, and once we get tax-exempt status we can begin applying for grants to move the project along. We need your help now to get the ball rolling!

Filing fees, domain names and hosting costs are estimated to be at $1000. A friend is willing to help design the website, but also informed me that the scope and complexity of my idea will pretty quickly require a design and programming team. Also I would like to put a more detailed explanation and include some psychological and anthropological insights into a self published book and put the profits back into the company.

I am hoping that with $3500 I can incorporate and apply for tax exemption status, begin website development and self-publish a book. Any contributions I receive will be put toward advancing this project. If I do not reach my funding goal, I will simply use whatever funds I do have to make as much progress as possible, and work towards other methods of funding.

I am so excited to discover this community and want to thank everyone for their involvement with this website, IndieGoGo is inspirational in its existence alone, and reaffirms the hope that my project will also succeed.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Any and all assistance and support is greatly appreciated!

Talk about this concept, blog about it, post links, start discussions! Try to remember some way you once wanted to change the world, or hopefully still do! Be inspired, have hope, have faith, believe in the strength of people, and of people in numbers. Please post about this, talk about this, go to our website (once it's functional) and buy some merchandise or become a member (when feature is possible).

If you have professional skills, advice or a desire to be more involved with this project please contact me!

story:
Around the world, 64 million girls are out of school.

In rural Malawi, only 5% will graduate high school.

We have the power to change that!

These startling facts emerged when I accompanied Eunice Napolo, a member of Malawi's parliament, to a film showing how girls all over the world struggle to go to school. 

After the screening, Eunice counted the many obstacles girls face in Thekerani, the poorest and most rural part of her own district, where only 5% will finish high school. A girl's family may not be able to afford a uniform and exam fees; she may have difficulty walking to a school six to eight miles away. She may not be able to avoid pregnancy and early marriage. But then Eunice confided that for girls too poor to afford underwear and a bra, it is embarrassment that keeps them home. At least one of those problems is easy to solve!

Imagine for a moment being a girl without underwear -- how would you feel sitting on the ground? Would you get up to answer a question or write on the board? If you had your period, would you walk six miles to school? What if all that stands between a girl going to school and staying home is something as simple as underwear?


Who are we? I'm Marika Rosen. I am a former high school teacher and now I work with emerging international leaders chosen by the U.S. Department of State. Last year I traveled with a group called "Women in Action," which included the Honorable Eunice Napolo, a former banker and now one of the youngest members of Malawi's parliament. In addition to her work as Chair of the powerful Budget and Finance Committee, Eunice returns regularly to the most rural part of her district in southern Malawi to mentor middle school girls. Sitting next to her at that film screening, I discovered that Eunice and I share a passion for girls' education.

Our goal is simple: to help girls in Thekerani by providing a bra, underwear and reusable sanitary pads as they make the critical transition from middle to high school. $3,250 will provide the essentials for 122 girls this year and next year -- if she will stay in school. It will also cover the cost of soccer balls for the boys, because we want them to stay engaged in school too. The money we raise will be sent via wire transfer to Eunice, who has agreed to purchase the items in Malawi so the money can benefit the local economy and help us avoid the cost of shipping.

What difference will your contribution make? 

* An extra year of education increases a women's earning power by 20%
(The World Bank, 2011).

* An educated girl is healthier: she is three times less likely to contract HIV (UNESCO, 2011) and six times less likely to be a child bride (International Center for Research on Women, 2006) or die in childbirth (EFA Global Monitoring Report, 2012).

* Your investment has a built-in multiplier effect: An educated mother is more than twice as likely to send her own children to school (UNICEF, 2010).

An education will give a girl a seat at the table when important decisions are being made that affect her future, her family, her community and our planet. We need all hands on deck! Will you join me to create a ripple effect, empowering girls around the world, starting with one rural community in Malawi?

How can you help?

  • You can simply "follow" the campaign to learn more about this global issue. 
  • You can make a contribution (see the perks!) $25 will cover the purchase of a bra, underwear and reusable pads -- but a contribution of any size will help! 
  • You can do it for your daughter, your niece, your sister - and in honor of your mom!
  • You can organize a donation pool at your workplace.
  • You can have bake sale at your school.
  • You can make noise! Get the word out by sending a personal note to your friends, telling them why you support this cause.
  • You can post this link on your Facebook page.
  • You can tweet the link to your followers.
  • You can contribute all month long because it's Women's History Month - and we want to make history and build a brighter future.

Thank you from Eunice, from me and from 122 girls in Thekarani, Thyolo District, Malawi.

story:
Thank You For Your Support!

I am launching Girl Justice because the empowerment of girls in the developing world is the single best thing a person can do to fight global poverty and improve the quality of life for human beings everywhere.

  • When you educate a girl, she earns more, invests in her family's education, and marries later
  • Your support can put girls through school, build wells to allow them access to fresh water at school, and ensure their feminine hygiene needs are covered
  • When you give now, you are supporting girls in the developing world and an organization that exists to elevate this cause to the forefront of the charitable world
  • Why girls? When you educate girls, they reinvest that money in their children's education. Up to 90% in fact. Whereas when you educate boys, statistically, they invest far less in their families and far more in whisky at the local bar. Sad but true.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds to get started making an impact!

  • $800 for our 501(c)3 application that allows us to be a tax-deductible non-profit. As of right now, Girl Justice is not yet a legal, on-paper charity. Your support helps pay for the attorney fees to get our paperwork done right.
  • Once the 501(c)3 application is complete, the remainder of the funds will go towards building a school in Southeast Asia, to help girls who otherwise might be trafficked for sex. 
  • If we reach some stretch goals (e.g., the full $5,000), then additional funds will go towards hosting a Women's Rights Movie Festival here in Ann Arbor next year. It would be called the FIERCE Women's Film Festival. 
  • FIERCE stands for Females Intent on Effecting Radical Change and Empowerment.
  • Hosting a film festival requires money for purchasing the rights to various movies and organizing venues.
  • Why a film festival? Because many people don't know about the causes of female education, or sex trafficking, or female genital cutting. I want to host a film festival that will raise awareness about the cause of empowering girls on a large stage.
  • Your gift of $100, $50, $25, or even $10 will go a long way to empowering women around the world. Thank you!

Here's T-Shirt Design #1

Here's T-Shirt Design #2


The Girl Justice Hoodie


The Impact

When you educate a girl, you change the world. Your gift helps prevent child marriages. Your gift helps girls stay in school longer. Your gift ensures girls don't skip school one week per month due to her cycle. Your gift provides funds for bathrooms, water wells, supplies, and scholarships.

Your gift of $100 makes you a founding donor for Girl Justice.

Your gift of $250 gives 100 girls sanitary pads.

Your gift of $500 gives a girl in Zimbabwe a year's worth of schooling, uniforms, and sanitary protection.

Thank you for your contribution!

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on Facebook and Twitter.

And spread the word! Share this campaign on social media. Let's change the world one girl at a time.

story:
Hello!

My name is James, I'm a student/writer/musician/bike mechanic/dishwasher and some time ago I realized that what I really really want is to intern at the Rachel Maddow Show, because they tell stories the way that I want to tell stories, and are also badass but still somehow mainstream, and also accessible but still critical, and I want to be a part of it all. 

So I collected a resume and letters of recommendation, and made the above video and holy of holies, it worked. They hired me. I start at the end of the month.

The internship pays, but not very much, and New York is expensive. On top of that, until about a week ago my bugdet included student loans, but those fell through. So here I am!

This is where you come in.

All told, this adventure is going to cost something like $10,000. But with the pay, and some surprise generous donations from my amazing and by no means well-off family, I have all but $2,500.

This is what you're helping fund if you contribute: 

-$450 Plane ticket. This is total round-trip. It's also a score. I'm lucky to have found it.

-$3,800 Rent in New York and partial rent in Vancouver: My partner and I share a one-bedroom, and though he's offered to pay more rent while I'm gone, I dont want him to suffer so I can follow my dreams. If I make more than my goal, this is where the money will go.

-$480 monthly transit passes in New York. So practical!

-$120-200 NY phone. The show communicates a lot via phone and text messages. I'm looking for the cheapest plan, so this is an estimate.

-$500 Passport, replacement IDs and related paperwork fees. I thought my Canadian passport and SS number would be sufficient. It wasn't. I had to get a lot of things expidited.

-$400 Work clothes and shoes. You mean these ripped shorts and tank-tops I've been fixing bikes and washing dishes in aren't enough?

-$4,000 Spending money, ($250/week). Food, entertainment, visiting my mom in Maine over a weekend, buying Rachel Maddow a drink, everything else. I hope to eat at least one meal a day at home, and have been googling cheap food in Manhatten, but this is where the city gets you, and I'd like to be able to join my co-workers at the bar after work if they offer.

If I don't make my goal, I will survive. I'm a student, I already know that there's a lot you can do with rice and potatoes.

But if I do...

This internship an amazing opportunity for me. It's the biggest thing I've ever asked for and the biggest thing I've ever gotten. If I can focus my energy on working as hard as possible, instead of on counting my pennies, the amount I'll be able to acheive will increase ten-fold. 

That being said, I acknowledge that I am by no means hard off. Like I said, I will survive if I don't make my goal.

Please don't contribute if you're short on money yourself.

But please contribute if you comfortably can, and if it makes you feel good to help me make my dreams come true!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but you think you know someone who can, and would like to, please share this!
story_txt:
Hello!
My name is James, I'm a student/writer/musician/bike mechanic/dishwasher and some time ago I realized that what I really really want is to intern at the Rachel Maddow Show, because they tell stories the way that I want to tell stories, and are also badass but still somehow mainstream, and also accessible but still critical, and I want to be a part of it all. 
So I collected a resume and letters of recommendation, and made the above video and holy of holies, it worked. They hired me. I start at the end of the month.
The internship pays, but not very much, and New York is expensive. On top of that, until about a week ago my bugdet included student loans, but those fell through. So here I am!
This is where you come in.


All told, this adventure is going to cost something like $10,000. But with the pay, and some surprise generous donations from my amazing and by no means well-off family, I have all but $2,500.
This is what you're helping fund if you contribute: 
-$450 Plane ticket. This is total round-trip. It's also a score. I'm lucky to have found it.
-$3,800 Rent in New York and partial rent in Vancouver: My partner and I share a one-bedroom, and though he's offered to pay more rent while I'm gone, I dont want him to suffer so I can follow my dreams. If I make more than my goal, this is where the money will go.
-$480 monthly transit passes in New York. So practical!
-$120-200 NY phone. The show communicates a lot via phone and text messages. I'm looking for the cheapest plan, so this is an estimate.
-$500 Passport, replacement IDs and related paperwork fees. I thought my Canadian passport and SS number would be sufficient. It wasn't. I had to get a lot of things expidited.
-$400 Work clothes and shoes. You mean these ripped shorts and tank-tops I've been fixing bikes and washing dishes in aren't enough?
-$4,000 Spending money, ($250/week). Food, entertainment, visiting my mom in Maine over a weekend, buying Rachel Maddow a drink, everything else. I hope to eat at least one meal a day at home, and have been googling cheap food in Manhatten, but this is where the city gets you, and I'd like to be able to join my co-workers at the bar after work if they offer.
If I don't make my goal, I will survive. I'm a student, I already know that there's a lot you can do with rice and potatoes.


But if I do...
This internship an amazing opportunity for me. It's the biggest thing I've ever asked for and the biggest thing I've ever gotten. If I can focus my energy on working as hard as possible, instead of on counting my pennies, the amount I'll be able to acheive will increase ten-fold. 
That being said, I acknowledge that I am by no means hard off. Like I said, I will survive if I don't make my goal.
Please don't contribute if you're short on money yourself.
But please contribute if you comfortably can, and if it makes you feel good to help me make my dreams come true!


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, but you think you know someone who can, and would like to, please share this!

story:
Here's What You're Contributing To

I'm a recovered anorexic, bulimic, and binge eater. I'm also a certified health coach. My dream is to create a revolutionary coaching practice that seeks to heal the heart of emotional eating and body image issues.

Using a method called The Option Process®, I will be able to effectively coach young women in exploring what created their unhealthy relationship with food. low self-esteem, and negative body image. This process was a godsend for me, personally, in clearing up remaining attachments that led to my believing that I wasn't good enough, which resulted in my eating disorder.

I have seen the effects that this work has on people with eating disorders. I have met and spoken with at least a dozen people in the last few months who  have used The Option Process to heal their own food issues.

What I Need & What You Get

I am looking to fundraise $1,500 to take PowerDialogues, which will will help me to gain better understanding of the role of a Mentor in the Option Process Dialogue.

I have volunteered for The Option Institute to get a $500 credit towards the program, and am in need of funding for the rest.

When you contribute to this campaign, you're changing someone's life. Body image issues impact a person's relationships, career, and confidence. Help someone get the help they need by donating any amount that's possible for you. Your help is so greatly appreciated that words could not even begin to describe the gratitude I have for your actions.

In addition to the warm, fuzzy feeling you'll get from creating a loving, happy, and healthy future for young girls everywhere, you'll also receive:

  • A handwritten thank you card from Shannon when you donate $10
  • A handwritten thank you card and video from Shannon when you donate $25
  • A 50-minute Dialogue with Shannon when you donate $50
  • A 50-minute Dialogue and follow-up coaching call with Shannon when you donate $100

*If the full $1,500 is not met, the money will still go towards the program.

The Impact You're Creating

Combining The Option Process, my health coaching training, and my own personal experience will create a program that helps these women and young girls to make a HUGE shift in the way they view themselves. I've seen people shift after even one 50-minute session.

How does this affect you? Besides the fact that you've done the world a great service by helping these young women, keep in mind the fact that the children of today are the future of our society. These young women have the potential to be great thinkers, discoverers, and leaders. When their mind is freed from an obsession with food and weight, the possibilities for where they can go are limitless.
Also, happy people inspire other people to be happy. The girls who will benefit from my training and coaching will spread their love and joy with countless people. You're actually contributing to a wider spread amount of love and joy on the planet. GO YOU!

Other Ways You Can Help

Not able to make a financial contribution at this time? Not to worry! There are plenty of other ways you can help:

  • Spread the word! Your friends, family, and colleagues may be willing to donate and share in the love!
  • Share this campaign with your social media peeps. The bigger the buzz, the more likely this dream is to come true!
  • Refer! If you know someone who is struggling with an eating disorder, please do not hesitate to let them know that I'm here to help. I'm happy to offer my services and any resources I'm aware of.
YOU, my dear reader, are AMAZING and freaking AWESOME. THANK YOU for reading this, contributing, and sharing your light with the world. YOU ARE LOVED AND APPRECIATED!!!

story:
Society for Rehabilitation of the Mentally Challenged (SOREM)- www.soremspecialchildren.org is an organigation in Chandigarh, India dedicated to improve lives of children impacted with mental/behavioral health issues. Founded by Promila Chandra Mohan - 83 year old youngster who still has unmatched energy and passion to make a difference to this community of special needs kids.

I have been associated with SOREM since 2011 and have experienced firsthand the hope it is delivereing to children and families facing stigma and who have been ostrasized by society in India. For these children, SOREM is the only home they have.

SOREM - A Non-Profit Organization, needs to raise $21000 this year to support these children, many of whom come from poor families who either can't afford to pay Rs 48000 ( 800 US Dollars ) per year or have no earning hand.   

It is an opportunity for us to add meaning to our money and help these kids be in their home where they learn to be part of us every day. Your contribution will help sponsor 25 kids to get  education for next 12 months. 

Contribute whatever is in your heart for these little kids fighting mental illness.

Spread the word for this campaign in your network as you can make the difference.


Best,
Sachin Chaudhry 

On behalf of www.soremspecialchildren.org

story:
The First Peace Hub in Egypt - Creating a Community of Peace Educators. 

We need your support in creating the first Hub for qualifying peace builders in Egypt.  The Hub is a physical and online space designed to bring together practitioners specialised in peace, to develop their knowledge and skills, discuss, and co-create new projects in order to strengthen their impact on the communities they work in. 

By supporting our project, you will be contributing to the development of a network of over 500 peace builders in Egypt who are tirelessly working in the field & are still lacking the resources that enable them to address the root causes of violence on the ground. 

 

So... who are we? 

Our organization, Misriyati (My Egypt) , started in 2004 with the dream of creating a peaceful Egypt; one where all identities are appreciated and welcomed. We realized that the traditional spaces of learning, be it family or school are incapable (or sometimes unwilling) to educate us about: how to deal with diversity, how to communicate our needs and feelings peacefully, and how to solve our conflicts non-violently.  Throughout the past 16 years we have supported thousands of individuals, groups, and organizations to build their capacity to deal with diversity and to pursue peaceful resolutions to conflicts. We have worked with refugees, young people, children, teachers, religious leaders, and community leaders, amongst others. The topics of our workshops focus on: identity, gender, social inclusion, conflict transformation, nonviolent communication, and collaborative teamwork. 

 

Why a Hub for Peace Educators? 

The Hub will help peace educators share and exchange their resources in a common space where they can support each other's learning and co-create impactful  peace building projects on the ground. By doing so, the Hub is envisioned to support the creation of a generation of highly qualified professionals in the field of peace and conflict transformation in Egypt. The Hub is also envisioned to attract young peace builders working on the causes of gender based violence, corporal punishment in schools, discrimination against refugees, and sectarian violence. Those professionals are expected to disseminate the knowledge and values of peaceful living in the different communities in which they work with.  Through sustaining the programs and events at the Hub and transparent media coverage, the Hub is expected to attract more and more people and build new partnerships and collaborations - which is vital for sustaining the Peace Hub impact on a long-term basis. 

 

Who will benefit from the Hub?

The Hub will directly benefit a network of over 500 currently practising peace educators from different communities in Egypt. These individuals will then diffuse their new skills and knowledge to the groups they work with in the form of workshops, sessions and presentations. This will contribute to more peaceful and educated communities in Egypt and a shift in society toward peace. 

Peace educators may include: facilitators and trainers working on peace building, or teachers who want to learn how to peacefully manage diversity in the classroom, and solve conflict; parents who are interested to raise your children in the values of peace; peace practitioners who seek support in designing or implementing peace-building projects; or just an Individual who is striking to apply of peace in their daily life.

 

What does it look like in practical terms?! 

The Hub will offer the following activities to peace educators: 

  1. TOT (Training of Trainers);  empowering junior peace educators from different parts of Egypt;
  2. Monthly meet-ups for peace educators to exchange knowledge and discuss compelling issues related to their experience in the field; 
  3. Regular short-term and long-term workshops in peace/conflict management ( offered by participating peace educators on:  managing diversity in classroom; nonviolent communication; peaceful parenting, conflict transformation, gender equality, inner peace, inclusive leadership, mediation, dialogue);
  4. Dialogue sessions and movie nights open to the public, around contemporary issues related to peace & violence (i.e.; harassment, identity, citizenship, social integration of refugees, etc.);
  5. Designing new methods and tools in peace education and sharing them on an online platform;
  6. Documentation of success stories from the ground on peaceful coexistence & nonviolent conflict transformation, to be published in the Peace Hub's monthly newsletter. 

 

Why are we crowdfunding? 

Because we believe in the power of human solidarity and our collective desire to promote peace in our world.  We believe in our collective ability to make the things we life. 

As young peace educators trying to establish a new field of knowledge and practice, we face a lot of challenges (as you can imagine), which we navigate with happiness and curiosity. But one thing we know for sure is that we are not alone, and we don’t have to carry the entire weight on our own.

Through your support, we are seeking seed funding to the hub and sustain its activities for a year. We want to cover the main fixed costs of the Peace hub on its online and offline form. It will support the establishment of the online platform ( website development and facilitation of online trainings and dialogues ). It will also support part of the rent, the renovation and the tools in the physical space (hopefully after CORONA situation is over) . Human Resources needed for the hub will be contributed on and based on the mutual benefits that every member of the hub will exchange with others. 

 

Our Perks!

Please note that the currency used in the campaign is Hong Kong Dollars! We are very thankful for your effort to help, and as a gesture of our gratitude:

- If you pay $100 HKD, Wohoo! You will get an invitation to one rocking Webinar on Non-violent Communication. You will be supporting the conduct of one workshop for 25 participants in the hub. 

- If you pay $200 HKD, get a glimpse of what is going on the ground! You will get an invitation to attend a One day workshop on Conflict Transformation at the hub. You will be supporting one month rent of the hub space. 

-If you pay $500 HKD, Youpee!! You will be recognized as one of our Top Peace Co-Creators in our website.  You will be supporting the design of 100 new educational tools & methods. 

- If you pay $1000 HKD, you are bringing about a new generation of Peace Educators! A space will be dedicated  you on our wall our new space in recognition for your generous support. You will be supporting the conduct of one TOT for 25 junior peace educators from all over Egypt. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help: 
Support The Peace-Hub by your knowledge: 

1- Propose ideas about workshops that can benefit fellow peace educators. 

2- Share a technique or a tool that can help in the peace-building process.

 

If can't make a contribution, please help us spread the word:

1. Host a crowdfunding party at your facility.

2. Share the campaign on your social media.

3. Follow us on Facebook and Instagram and share our campaign updates:

https://www.facebook.com/Peacehubegypt

https://www.instagram.com/peacehubegypt

4. Get the word out using the #SupportPeaceEgypt
#DonateForPeace

Thank you for your support!

Contact the team!

For any questions or comments about our crowdfunding campaign, or to learn more about Misriytai or the Peace Hub please:

Email us: info@misriyati.org

Message us: www.facebook.com/Misriyati

Empower Venezuelan Entrepreneurs to Launch their Startups and create Jobs.

Hola! 

I'm Ilya, Kick Director at Spring, a purpose driven activator in Vancouver.

We support entrepreneurs who are working at the intersection of technology and impact. 

Our incubator program, Kick, has helped over 60 entrepreneurs launch and scale their businesses, some of which are now valued in the millions of dollars.

We got introduced to student entrepreneurs in the Parque Tecnologico Sartenejas in Caracas Venezuela. They are working on 4 different startups and are in need of some top notch mentorship from an international source. 

Unfortunately, the Venezuela government has restricted the amount of foreign currency a Venezuelan can spend to only $300 a year online. 

However, these entrepreneurs suggested offering up their technology and design talent to help crowdfund their tuition and allow you to benefit from their skills.

International Impact Arbitrage 

Let's be honest, things are not going well in Venezuela now and allowing these entrepreneurs to share their skills with you will be a great opportunity for them.

The tech sector is one of the only bright lights of the Venezuelan Economy and their young people. 

Here are the people and project you'll be able to impact and what they can do for you: 

INpetus: On demand platform to match startups with services. 

Team: David Goudet, Andrea Díaz, Gabriel Freitas, Denisse González.

Gamekip: Software to Gamification for workplace motivation

Team: Leo Ramos, Alejando Ballesta. 

Una Raya Más: AirBnB for Tatoos

Team: Daniel Marín, Andrés Guerrero, Héctor Goncalves.

Pago en Red:  Digital Parking lot payments 

Team: Jesús Peñaloza, Esteban Struve. 

Tap into an international talent pool & help develop an emerging market.

By supporting these entrepreneurs, you'll be able to get: 

  • A friend in Venezuela for life.
  • An insider tour of the Caracas startup scene.
  • Super deals on logos, landing pages and MVP's.
  • Translation of your website into Spanish
  • Custom tech work and a new market of opportunities. 
NOTE: All the technical work will be done by the team at Una Raya Mas. You can see a sample of their work here. 
Other Ways You Can Help

No worries if you can't chip in financially. You can still help by: 

  • Spreading the word  on Social Networks
  • Referring a friend who is looking for some technology help.

Thanks so much,

The Spring Family

story:
The International Space University (ISU) Space Studies Program (SSP) 2015 is underway in Athens, Ohio and it's time to rouse ISU alumni and friends for this year's graduation gifts.

In the spirit of this year's SSP theme #IncreaseTheAwesome, I have ordered 160 laser-engraved crystal paperweights. Each paperweight is roughly 2 3/8" width x 2 3/8" height x 1 inch depth (5.87x5.87x2.54 cm). All donations of $100 USD or more may select a perk containing one of these crystal paperweights.

Thank you to my current donors!  You have helped make this happen!  But I still more donors to help pay the bills! 

Every donation helps and all donations will be used to support SSP15.  Perks are available for any donation of $75 or more.  See the gallery for perk item photos.   Perks will expire with this campaign on Monday July 13, 2015.

This is a flexible campaign.  I receive all donations.  All donations will be used to support SSP15.

In addition to the crystal paperweights, your donations will help cover the cost of other graduation items including gift bags, ISU magnets, decals, buttons and SSP15 session note cards. 

Yes this is crazy! Join in the fun! Share and promote this campaign with other ISU alumni, friends and supporters. 

Let's take #IncreaseTheAwesome to a whole new level!  

If you make a donation, please leave a comment.  What does ISU mean to you?  Feel free to share your thoughts and ISU stories.


PERK ITEM DIMENSIONS:

ISU crystal paperweight - square = 2.3125 x 2.3125 x 1 inch (5.87 x 5.87 x 2.54 cm)

ISU crystal paperweight - block = 3.125 x 1.9375 x 1.875 inch (7.94 x 4.92 x 4.76 cm)

ISU crystal paperweight - round = 2.875" diameter x .9375" thick (7.30 dia x 2.38 cm)

ISU patch = 3.25 x 2.25 inch (8.25 x 5.72 cm)

ISU decal = 3.5 x 2.5 inch (8.89 x 6.35 cm)

ISU key chain = 2.375 x 1 inch (6.03 x 2.54 cm)

SSP15 coffee mug = 3.125 inch diameter x 4.5 inch height (7.94 dia x 11.43 cm height)

SSP15 gift bag = 7.75 x 9.75 x 4.75 inches (19.7 x 24.7 x 12 cm)
